Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Petri T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice stay, good breakfast. Some problems with our reservations. Located well, near train and tram stations. Negative point, we couldn't find and supermarket close to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for the price”
Reviews.Author: IanrJones10
Reviews.Content: I have no problems with this hotel. Clean and comfortable, with good access to train, metro and tram services. The hotel is way outside the centre of Amsterdam but access to and from the centre (and main train station) is easy from the nearby tram (number 4) terminus. If you have an OV chip card the nearby metro station will again give you easy access to Amsterdam Centraal railway station. Schiphol airport is a short train ride away from Amsterdam Rai railway station. RAI station, Tram terminus and Metro station are all located together and around 100m from the hotel. If you want to experience Amsterdam culture and chiming churches and canals this hotel isn't for you and you will need to spend probably 3 times the price getting an equal standard of hotel in the centre. However if you want a clean, quiet, convenient hotel then the Novotel is for you. I can't comment on business services/wi-fi, but forget your computers and IPads; picture book Amsterdam is just 15-20 minutes away. Go and enjoy it for real.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Business”
Reviews.Author: 51MES
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the Business and Financial area along with conference vebues near Amsterdam RAI/Amsterdam Zuid. As rooms go, reasonably basic but all things you would need, including free WiFi. MiniBar prices not too extortionate. The restaurant is far above the room standard. Small menu but range of cuisines and very well cooked and presented. Tomato soup is well presented and amongst the best I have had for a long time. Venison steak was fabulous and Prawn and Shrimp Curry was very flavoursome. Onsite shop caters to the business traveller (I needed a power converter as mine broke) as well as the tourist (Won't say tat but not my scene!). Friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff. Shame I had no kit for the Sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, bit far out from the main city though”
Reviews.Author: Emphilpot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in March 2012. The hotel is clean & modern, decent sized rooms for Europe. It is a bit out from the main part of town, about a 10-15 minute tram ride. But it is convenient if you are visiting the RAI convention centre. The hotel has free internet & a nice restaurant, overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, annoying, but passable business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fosssil
Reviews.Content: I spent several nights at this Novotel while attending a conference at the nearby RAI conference center. The RAI is about a 10 minute walk so the hotel's location is good, so long as it's not raining. The hotel overall is basic and passable but has a lot of annoying aspects. The decor is dated, the carpets are dirty and shabby, and the hotel overall feels cheap, cramped, and in need of an update. If I were coming to the RAI again I'd try the Holiday Inn across the street, though I haven't investigated its reviews. Here are the things I found frustrating about this hotel: 1. Brusque front desk service. My assistant (no longer working for me) had goofed and booked me for arrival a day earlier than I actually arrived. This was a surprise to me. The desk clerk was more obnoxious about it than necessary. 2. The hotel provides free wireless internet, which is certainly a plus, but it requires going through a very annoying start page to accept their terms every time you connect. My cell phone, iPad, computer, etc. would all drop the connection after awhile, necessitating going through this hassle over and over and over and over again. Why can't they just provide internet and be done with it? Or have their system remember the MAC address of each device and the fact that it has ALREADY accepted the terms! 3. The hotel has only four elevators and these are absolutely overwhelmed at check-in and check-out hours. I wound up waiting in large crowds of people for long periods of time just to get to the lobby or up to my floor. I also had many a ride up and down that stopped on EVERY floor due to the overload. 4. The gym is OK ... a couple of treadmills, a couple of elipticals, a couple of stationary bikes, and some rudimentary weights. It's located on the "first" floor (the floor above the ground floor) and there is no way to get to it by the elevators. They don't stop on that floor! You have to go to the lobby, then walk up stairs to the first floor. But then there is a nasty surprise waiting for you: your key won't open the gym! You have to go back to the lobby, wait in line for a desk clerk (in your gym shorts!), and ask them to activate your room key card for the gym. It's unfathomable why they don't just do this automatically with every room key. 5. When phoned, the staff is helpful but VERY slow to respond to anything that requires someone coming to the room. They promised to bring me various items, pick up laundry, etc. Each time it took 30 minutes or more before the promised person showed up. 6. The maid cleaning my room screwed up something just about every day. Examples: didn't replace an obviously dirty used drinking glass, did not provide a new doorknob card for ordering breakfast (requiring a call to the front desk and long wait to get one), did not replace the coffee creamers after I had used them up. 7. My room was too hot and there was no way to cool it down. The room has separate controls for heat and air conditioning. I turned the heat off and turned the air conditioning to maximum. Result? The air vent made a lot of noise but just recirculated the air in the room without cooling it. I think the air conditioning system must be turned off because it's winter. The room does have a window that can be opened, but only a tiny bit (presumably for safety reasons). I wound up leaving it open all the time but the room was still too hot. 8. Along with #7, a huge frustration was that the hotel provides only a thick down duvet, which is much too hot for the temperature of the room. 9. The hotel has room service food but the menu options are extremely limited. It's the shortest room service menu I've seen anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel made our amsterdam trip magical !!!!”
Reviews.Author: lyndsey s
Reviews.Content: Hello me and my boy friend just got back from the novotel ansterdam , 1st impressions very clean and staff were straight there to check you in no hanging around got card x2 for the room even got a card to the sauna (shame i didnt take my cozi )then straight up to the room great sized room the bed was huge and a choice of soft and hard pillows which i thought was a nice touch .Bed sheets and fresh towles changed every day ,there is a mini bar which you get your own key for but we recomend taking your own munch and pop with you as both hotel and amterdam prices for pop crisps chocolate is unreal 5 euros for bottle water.we paid 12 euros for 2 cans of pop and two chocolates . Tram to main dam square/central station is a 5 min walk from hotel then tram number 4 last but 1 stop also purchse a 48 hr tram ticket works out so much cheaper .staff at the novohotel really are nice people they couldnt help us enough even gave us a map and told us where to go always saying hello asking if we are ok will advise when getting to the hotel will have to leave a deposit of 70 euros but will get it bk at end of trip as long as tab ect is paid {mini bar ).all in all we had a fantastic time at the novotel city the only disadvantage id say as going to amsterdam as smokers a none smoking hotel was abit of a nightmare but this did not stop us having a magical time :o)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, far from the action”
Reviews.Author: toomanynouns
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a tour package, so I can't say if it was a good value or not. Our room was clean, nice looking, and quiet. However, we had asked for a twin bed room and were given a double bed instead. Fortunately the room included a pull out sofa so it wasn't too much of an inconvenience. The lobby has a nice gift shop.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel near RAI Exhibition Center”
Reviews.Author: EKCH_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam for an exhibition at the RAI Exhibition Center. The RAI is conveniently located directly by a train station, where trains from the airport call; meaning that transfers to/from Schiphol are easily made in 15 minutes at a cost of 2.50 Euros. The Novotel is located less than 200 meters from the train station and about 400 meters from the RAI. It is a classic business-class hotel, recently renovated and has a nice ambience. Like an earlier reviewer, I too ended up in a room with two single beds, having asked for a double in my reservation. Free wifi access worked fine, and all the equipment in the gym was new and in good condition, as was the saune. The only thing lacking, when comparing to similar hotels elsewhere, would be a swimming pool. I needed an iron and called housekeeping. It was brought to my room within 5 minutes of placing the request. The breakfast buffet was fine, but at 22.50 Euros somewhat expensive, considering the price already paid to stay in the hotel... While the hotel is on the outskirts of the city, the No. 4 tram terminates just outside the hotel and takes you to the Central Station in about 10 minutes at a price of 2.70 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel in inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: 4sure86
Reviews.Content: Hotel was modern and well equipped, and there is a fridge in the room. Inexpensive by Amsterdam standards. The room was small compared to Australian hotels but was not small by Amsterdam standards (whereby most rooms are very small), however, being this far out from the centre I would have thought the land would be cheaper and that they could have made the rooms bigger. The room did have a fold out couch which was useful as I was travelling with a friend. The hotel is close to the metro and tram station. We got the tram to the centre but the trams are not particularly regular and it is a long ride. If you are a tourist wanting to see the historic centre, I would not recommend this hotel purely based on the location. That said, a hotel of equivalent quality in the centre would be more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: andrejens
Reviews.Content: Fair sized rooms, clean and tidy. Nice re-decorated bar and restaurant area. Breakfast is al-right, order your own omelette is a nice feature. The dinner menu is rather boring, and so is the food. I'd eat out elsewhere if possible. A thank you to the excellent bartender who took very good care of us, mixing up drinks on request. Room service was slow, 30+ minutes for a simple dish. TV signal kept dropping out for no apparent reason. And Novotel please, one ironing board placed in the hallway to be shared by the whole floor is not good enough. I'd like on in my room. Location is ideal for visitors to the RAI (convention centre), but not the best choice for exploring the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Rai, far from elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: BinDereDoneDat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst attending meeting at the Rai. So the hotel is about 5-10 minutes walk from the Rai and 3 minutes from a Train/Metro /Tram station. About 30 min or less from airport wit h about 6 trains an hour to the airport. Rooms are reasonably sized and shower works well. Good supply of shampoo and body lotion. Pillows too soft but there are extra in the wardrobe. Breakfast is fine and they have newspapers to read whilst having your breakfast. Mixed fruit for putting on your cereal, but pineapple mixed with melon and apple, whereas I just prefer pineapple only. There is nowhere in particular to walk to after the conference - there are some restaurants around which seem OK - I had a pizza in a Sicilian place and it was quite nice and good value - pizza, beer and salad was about â‚¬20. The hotel itself seemed fairly expensive for what was there - â‚¬149 incl B'fast + Sales Tax, per night. It would have been better to stay in a hotel near the centre of Amsterdam and then commute to the Rai. Museums etc seem to close around 5pm so if you want to see anything you need to arrive early.

Reviews.Title: “Good & clean place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bubs789
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not in the centre of Amsterdam it is still a great place to stay. We spent 2 nights here the beginning of February and were not dissappointed. The hotel lobby is very modern and spotless, even though it had been snowing and people were walking through with wet feet constantly. The rooms are not the largest we have ever stayed in but there is plenty of room with the usual, TV, mini bar etc. Again the room was spotless, the bathroom had plenty of space, clean towels etc. We didnt eat there but the menu looked nice enough with plenty of choice and seemed quite good value for money. Like I said earlier this hotel is not in the centre of Amsterdam, infact it is a good 20 minute tram ride away, but with the trams been very regular and on time this isnt a problem. In fact we bought a 24 hour pass and used it to visit places we havent been to before. The tram (no 4) ends just a few minutes walk from the hotel and there is also a train station at the same place.

Reviews.Title: “Average in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Bob T
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Amsterdam makes a good first impression, nicely done lobby and walking distance to the RAI Conference Center. With the white tiles, they were constantly mopping the floor, felt sorry for the cleaning crew. Room sizes are good, are clean, very spartan and dorm room like in decor and finishes. Service was great, front desk speaks english well and getting a cab was never a problem. On site restaurant does your basic business hotel breakfast, with european cold cut selection too, but for dinner tries to be both Asian and American, being Asian American I found the combination confusing... food was OK. Go out into old Amsterdam for dinner at one of the great Indonesian places. All in all, if you're attending a conference at RAI, it's a convenient place to stay, won't find much to write home about, at least at the Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wrong place to stay if not event at RAI”
Reviews.Author: Ferdinand1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at executive floor: room 1532 Bathroom has no heating at all, ventilation in bathroom is so strong that needs to be covered! Towels are old! At arrival room was freezing cold. Restaurant is basic with a strange food selection. Nearby elevator room was noisy, bad sleeping...

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel Near the RAI Exhibition Centre”
Reviews.Author: AzzyBaby
Reviews.Content: My third stay at this hotel while attending the ISE exhibition at the RAI. Fully refurbished and extended over the last couple of years so everything looks pretty new. The cost of breakfast is â‚¬22 so not very good value for money unless you are a BIG eater. Trains and trams nearby so easy to get into Amsterdam city centre. Staff very friendly and helpful. FREE wifi is a nice touch but if you want faster internet comnnection there is a network canle in the room but you have to pay for this service. The lobby lounge area is nicely designed and has several iMac computers with printers attached, very useful for printing out your boarding cards. A nice hotel if a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel shame about the attitude of the receptionist”
Reviews.Author: Nade20115
Reviews.Content: This is not a city centre hotel however it does not mean it isnt an excellent place to stay whilst in Amsterdam. It is clean, crisp and tidy with nice rooms, king size beds and a good size bathroom. Tea and coffee is provided in the rooms along with a hairdryer. There is a big bar which is reasonably priced but gets busy on the evening especially when there is exhibitions on at the nearby Rai centre. The hotel is next to the last tram stop of route 4, the trams run every 10 minutes all day and the last tram leaves the central station at 00:37 hrs so you can still enjoy a good night out and not miss your tram, if you want to stay out later there is a night bus which takes you back to the hotel and taxi's are cheap and easy to find. A 3 day Tram/bus/train pass is 15 euro 50 and is unlimitied us. you can buy the passes on the tram or at the central ticket office. My only negative comment about my stay here was the female on reception ( I wish I had got her name)who checked me in was so very rude I was astonished, my friend was checking in next to me with another member of staff and was informed about all aspects of the hotel and local travel while I got thrust a room key with some dirty looks!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and good service”
Reviews.Author: nomad t
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel. Newly built with multilingual staff working at the front desk. The breakfast was really nice and its easily accessible from the airport or train station.

Reviews.Title: “Regular visitor”
Reviews.Author: Koshkha
Reviews.Content: I stay here most months for work as it's one of the hotels my company likes us to use. The public spaces and restaurant are gorgeous as a result of a major refurb a couple of years ago. The bedrooms are like Novotel bedrooms anywhere in the world - very formulaic, very predictable and a star or two lower in standard than the rest of the hotel. The staff are lovely - which is unusual in Holland. The restaurant is expensive but has some interesting dishes (although you can get bored of them very quickly if you stay too often). Breakfast choices are extensive. The hotel is very popular with Japanese and other oriental tour groups and the menus are designed to appeal to that particular audience. The location is well out of the city but the trams run nearby and the hotel is very close to the Amsterdam RAI train station which connects to Schipol airport in about 10 minutes and for a tiny fraction of the cost of a taxi. Lots of restaurants are available about 10-15 minutes walk (or a couple of tram stops) away on Europa Plein or Scheldestraat. The hotel has parking spaces but rates are quite high. Free wi-fi is included in the room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danidani1982
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely stay here for our honeymoon. We had been warned the hotel was out of the city and on the first day we thought we'd catch the train to the hotel - big mistake! We had to take two trains out of the city - it was much easier to get the tram. The room itself was nice and clean, and had free tea and coffee available. The bathroom was nice and spacious, with a good-sized bath and speakers so you could listen to the tv. My husband used the sauna and said it was great. The staff were courteous and professional. After checking out we realised we'd left something in the room so we phoned the hotel. A member of staff checked the room and called us back straightaway when they'd found the missing item - my husband's passport! Would definitely stay here again - might even try the breakfast next time as we thought it was a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Staff was helpful. The hotel is quite far away from the city center but there is a very easy access via tram 4 located 3 min away from the hotel. The rooms were big and spacious, the beds were very comfortable. Breakfast had an amazing variety of food. The hotel is not new but is in good condition. The Internet connection is free and works great. The towels are old. 22 euro's a day for parking was expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have stayed at the Hotel and I can't fault it in anyway. The staff were friendly and helped with any questions I had, the room was in excellent condition and the bed very comfy which is all I want after a long days work. Will be back next time I need to stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel is excellent”
Reviews.Author: ReadersouthernUSA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our Globus European Tapestry Tour. This hotel is very modern and nice! Even though it is not downtown, we were able to easily take a taxi to go see Amsterdam in our free time. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone! I've rated everything we used as excellent and though I could not vouch for the children's activities I have no doubt they are excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Too many things didn't go as I expcted”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellingGabo
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel for New year's Eve. We book ed two night through a voucher we had received as a gift. We got there around 12.30 and we expected the room to be ready. it was not, because it was a busy time - they said - but we were offered to upgrade to executive floor at 50 Euro per night. Wireless and minibar use included in the upgrade fee. When we got to our room it was clearly below expectations for an executive room. Definitely big and spacious but carpet flooring and poor refurbishment made it look a bit dull. The only plus was a very nice king size bed. The bathroom was basic, the tub a bit dirty and to our surprise, this included minibar consisted of 2 bottles of pepsi, two beers, orange juice and water. There was complimentary coffee (3 shots of espresso with a tiny Nespresso machine) and tea. Location: although 2 train stops away from Schiphol Airport, the city centre is quite far away. There is indeed a tube station in the nearby and a tram (line 4) that takes you directly to the heart of town but it is a 20-min journey. On New year's Eve then, trams stop at 8 pm (of course, they would be set on fire by irresponsible people firing petards and fireworks everywhere around) so to go back we had to take a cab and the journey was charged 30 Euro!!! Overall I think this hotel would make a great stop over if you want to be somewhere near the airport and not too far away from the city centre but it is such a pity to stay here if you want to enjoy Amsterdam, there are many hotels, B&B and pensions that would offer you a much better location.

Reviews.Title: “Low quality of service and small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 1. The triple room is very small, like a double room. 2. The menu at restaurant is too simple. 3. The household linen is dirty. 4. The radiators in a room is outdated. 5. The window can be opened regularly. 6. 4 Stars are unreal, the real stars for this hotel are 3.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent stay...”
Reviews.Author: Jay S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel from 26-dec-2011 to 31-dec-2011. Pro's: Clean, spacious hotel, room is a decent size. free internet access and printing in lobby. internet access in room is free but i didn't use this. Really helpful & friendly staff. The breakfast buffet was very good, could probably do with a little more choice on the hot food, i.e. no fried mushroom, hash browns only on 2 of our days there, no grilled tomatoes etc. Very spacious restaurant. Only 10 mins from central Amsterdam on tram which is only 5 mins walk away so very convenient. Con's: mini bar prices are atrocious. A bottle of water was 5 euro's! The dinner menu is very limited. And to this the prices of the meals which was expensive (2 drinks, 2 main meals, 1 desert was 50 euro's). The desert alone was 7.5 euro's, which i wouldn't mind but it was nouvelle cuisine to the extreme. A little cake the size of a table spoon on a big plate with some mango sauce dribbled on the side. Terrible! If the prices weren't so high, the food better and more choice, then maybe they would have more guests staying for dinner. I cannot be alone in thinking this because on every night i was there, only a small handful of people were having dinner when i walked past the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Spotngrey
Reviews.Content: Service was good. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet was nice. Modern decor. Bit remote from downtown but nearby tram station.

Reviews.Title: “American staying at Novotel Amsterdam City”
Reviews.Author: AandJ_Travelling
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a 3 day visit to Amsterdam. Hotel is modern, wifi available in room and there are computers available in the lobby. Service was good, friendly front counter provided a map of the city and directions to the street car (RAI). If you drive a car to the hotel make sure you have a small one; the parking spaces are small. Parking is also a separate charge from the room and is paid at check out. As others have stated it is quite a ways from the city center, about 30 min RAI ride; don't try to drive into the city center, traffic and parking are terrible. However, getting to the city center is convenient with the RAI station only about five/six hundred meters from the hotel. If your coming to Amsterdam for a trade show it is very convenient with the exhibition halls right near by. We only at breakfast at the hotel, paid for it as part of the booking, and it has to be hands down one of the best breakfast buffets we've had in Europe. Large spread of salads, bread, meats, cheeses, omelets to order, on and on. The room was clean and comfortable; being American it isn't spacious but is cozy. Bathroom was clean and had a nice tub/shower with good water pressure. Only drawback to the room was the noise level; we could hear the water in the pipes from showers/toilet flushes; not sure if it was just our room It was a minor annoyance so we didn't make a fuss or request to be moved. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location when you are visiting Amsterdam RAI bit far from the city tough”
Reviews.Author: ICI01
Reviews.Content: When I had to go to a conference in RAI I choose to stay in the Novotel. rooms and public places recently renovated so that was OK and nice looking. big hotel and elevators are slow so in the morning rush our waiting times are long. Parking spaces are very narrow and all in all there are not enough of them, you need to be lucky to get a spot in peak periods. Buffet breakfast was fine with lots of choises. WiFi was for free, that is certainly and advantage!

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Amsterdam City”
Reviews.Author: Belflyer1 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - located near the RAI centre in downtown Amsterdam - very moden check-in area with speedy and efficient check-in The rooms are very modern and well equipped - flat screen TV and wifi through out the building Restaurant is an East West Fusion mix and I tried the Eastern menu - it was OK but I think Eastern visitors would be a little disappointed as the spicing is very mild Breakfast buffet is very varied with lots of cold offerings and a good choice of warm food as well - only downside is the price 21.50 Euros which is a little steep for a coffee, juice and croissant

Reviews.Title: “Good place for one night transit”
Reviews.Author: gregntrees
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to the airport. Good and clean room. Excellent breakfast Excellent place to stay especially for one night transit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: danandrei
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good. You can get to the airport in 10 minutes by train (they come every 10 minutes and a ticket is 2.6 Euro). The hotel is 50 meters from the RAI railway station. The view from the room is also interesting if you get a high level room. The hotel is not new but is in good condition. The breakfast was very good, one of the best. The Internet connection is free and works great. Maybe there is the need for some capital renovation in 1-2 years. I didn't like there were no glasses in the room (only made of plastic) so if you wanted to drink a bear or a wine in the room you should drink using the plastic glasses. Also a pen/pencil is necessary in the room. The towels are old. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly not 4 stars, icecold bathroom, exekutive was not good!”
Reviews.Author: Nillapilla
Reviews.Content: Not serviceminded people, just two persons was good, one in the restaurant and one when we took our luggage before we left If they have City in the name, it shall not take 25 minutes to city :-(

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Modern Hotel in Amsterdam Outskirts”
Reviews.Author: Sunburst1111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent in its outlay, very clean and modern. The Check-in was simple and the staff were friendly and helpful offering us a free map of the city. We had a room on the 2nd floor which was spotless, modern and had every mod-con you could need, flat screen Tv, sofa, stocked mini-bar (bit Pricey) and nice powerful shower. We didnt get breakfast in the Hotel the 2 nights we stayed but the bar downstairs was lovely with the drinks priced reasonable for the city. We had forgot the plug adaptor but the reception kindly lent us one for the duration of the stay. (8euros in the city) Wi-Fi was free at the Hotel and very quick, Tv Had English, Dutch, German, Spanish and italian Channels. Altho located close to flight path and a busy junction there was no noise to be heard, the windows were double glazed sound proofed, together with the black out blinds in the room it insured a good quality sleep. The Hotel is value for money (the money we paid) the downside of the hotel is its location, altho serviced by the 4 tram it is a good 25-35 minutes from the central station depending on the time, difficult to nip back with bags of shopping or to get changed quickly, if you are only in the city for a short time, i would recommend paying the extra to stay closer to the city centre. Other Than Distance from centre i would give this hotel 10/10..

Reviews.Title: “Big and good”
Reviews.Author: Lavanan Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was super. Near hotel is tram stop and train stop. We get there quit easely from airport and Ajax stadium. Price is high but this is Amsterdam. Busy hotel but everithing was fine with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: fitzsimons
Reviews.Content: A bit further out of town than you might want but an easy journey on the #4 tram. We got a good rate for B&B at the weekend so decided to stay out here. If you've stayed at a Novotel before you'll know what to expect of the rooms but the lobby is quite impressive. Most impressive of all was the quality of service we received. Every interaction we had with the staff - reception, restauarant, housekeeping - was just great; they could not have been more helpful. A good breakfast and free wi-fi just added to our experience. I'd come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tagesthemen
Reviews.Content: No surprises here in terms of the room. It has the standard Novotel look. If you have stayed in a Novotel before, you know what you are getting. Love the free WifI (more hotels please take note) and also computer terminals in the lobby. Perfect for the Rai and for getting to the airport using Rai train station. It is essentially a conference hotel, so if you get a good rate when a conference is not on, don't complain that it's not in the centre - that's why you got a good rate. Nevertheless, the tram is close by so it is well-connected with the whole public transportation network. Breakfast quite good. They even have little booths with TVs for people who are by themselves. Nice touch. Also had lunch here once and it was good and great service. The front desk was a bit frosty but maybe I got them on a bad day.

Reviews.Title: “A Novotel Novelty for me”
Reviews.Author: TaxiFaber
Reviews.Content: I've never been very impressed with the cookie-cutter mould the Accor Hotel chain uses to style its hotels in, often soulless prefab places from the Ibis up to what used to be the top, the 4* Novotel. This French owned group are not the most inviting hoteliers and tend to go for middle-of-the road-hospitality. Or so I thought. It's obviously too long ago since I stayed in one of the Accor products. Close to the RAI exhibition centre and Amsterdam RAI station -walking distance- I found a pleasant exception, although I recognised some standard Accor-style elements. There is nothing else around the hotel to nip out to, no shops, no bars, no nothing. Price/Quality ratio is fine. And to dispel the notion about all cabs in Amsterdam being bad: from Novotel I took a cab twice to the RAI (an extremely short trip of 7.50 euro), and was neither overcharged nor refused. I found that sticking to a brand (TCA in this case) often makes sure you're not fleeced. At least you have a come-back if it should happen. Just don't take 'unlabeled' cabs (no or neutral roofsign) from Central Station or Leidseplein. Go for a brand-name. Reception staff were extremely friendly and helpful (the display of Sinterklaas-delicacies you could help yourself to whilst checking in, helped), check-in was swift and the room was large enough for two. Perhaps not large, but the fact that there is a couch and a chair helps. The area where the lifts are is strangely wide and decidedly bland and boring. Room service was quick and helpful, choice is not particularly large. Just one comment about catering: when my wife showed up for breakfast five minutes before closing, staff at the entrance were decidedly unfriendly, as if they were unhappy that she had turned up in the last five minutes before closing. Breakfast is large and varied. The bar area is nice. Staff are helpful and friendly. One big minus though: when you're sitting at the tables near the entrance beware: cars and cabs dropping people at the entrance often leave their lights on, which shine straight at you in the bar. A foil on the outside windows would prevent this from happening. All in all a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “I expected more...”
Reviews.Author: BusyBeeEssex
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for access to the station and exhibition centre. The reception is impressive and the dining/bar areas are spacious, modern and clean. Unfortunately thats where it ends - once you get into the elevator you step out onto a lack lustre landing, camel beige carpets, drab decor. drooms are small and pretty much like a travellodge - harsh not really the bathroom is plain and dingy, toilettries -well you might as well not bother. We decided to eat in the restaurant as the mixed menu of East versus West, was really tempting - the food was ok, service a little slow but was not deserved of the price tag. Would i use this hotel again - yes, for the ease of getting to the airport, town centre and exhibition centre . It's not that the hotel are doing anything particularly bad - its just not upto the standard of other Novotels.

Reviews.Title: “A compromise”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Zelf
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times over the years - always for business reasons. Rooms are large, breakfast, restaurants and bars are all A-OK. Location is a compromise. There isn't anything at walking distance so to get anywhere of Internet you're forced to use a bus, tram or taxi. Ps: don't use the taxi's in Amsterdam, they are a rip-off

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Novotel”
Reviews.Author: carly y
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a package with Co-operative travel in the UK with P&O cruises. We stayed in the hotel for two nights, for valentines day in February and found our stay very pleasant and comfortable. Novotel Amsterdam is quite a large hotel, and it is very Clean and tidy. The location isnt too central, and is near quite a busy road. However traffic is not heard from the hotel, and the tramstop about 10 seconds walk up from the hotel, it is just a short 10 minuite ride to the main square in Amsterdam centre. However you can get off the tram a little earlier and visit the tulip market. Where the Edam Cheese shop also is! We had a really lovely time in amsterdam and at this hotel, the beds were very comfortable too and it had a nice big bath for a soak after strolling around the town all day!

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Amsterdam City”
Reviews.Author: Ali_Iran_shiraz
Reviews.Content: Location is great; it's on a very beautiful street with old and tall trees (Europaboulevard). Only by 2 minutes walking, you can visit a very nice and big park (amstelpark). Also itâ€™s only 5 minutes walking to Rai Amsterdam Exhibition Center. There is a tram and also metro station by 2 minutes walking from the hotel. By tram, you may reach city center in 15 minutes. Tram ticket price is 2.6 Euro. Tram time schedule is from early morning to 00:40 in midnight. If you like enjoy Amsterdam night life later than that time, taxi price from city center to the hotel is around 20 Euro. In my opinion, the price for a 4 stars hotel is very valuable. If you love breakfast, this is a right place for you! This hotel serves unbelievable breakfast with a wide range of foods. Staffs are very friendly. You have free wireless internet in rooms and lobby. Beware that only wireless internet is free. If you use internet socket in the rooms, you should pay 5 Euro per day. If you have not laptop, there are some computers in the lobby that you may use free. There is free tea and coffee and coffee maker in the rooms. But minibar is very expensive. Also there is free spa and fitting center in first floor. All in all, this is a very nice place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Eddiecat34
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with two colleagues while exhibiting at the nearby RAI centre. Although quite expensive (up to Euro199 each night + breakfast), I couldn't fault anything. Service and attitude of staff was helpful and calming, breakfast was extensive, rooms clean and facilities good. Easy parking (for our v.large van), taxis always outside, busy bar. The walk to the RAI centre is 5-6 minutes, to the station only 3. Taxis to the centre of Amsterdam are 15 minutes and c. Euro20. We didn't eat in the restaurant. Certainly a great 'business' hotel - for a family staying to explore Amsterdam I'd suggest being closer to the centre in one of the many 'traditional' hotels,

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good allround - except the average evening meal”
Reviews.Author: g t
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay 21 & 22 nov - everything about this 'business style' hotel is top notch - altho the 'non english' style breakfast made us chuckle (as we go around the world it is always amusing to see what 'variations' from full english appear) - this time alongside the bacon & scrambled eggs it was vegetable fried rice - that was a new one ! The reception staff, the rooms, the bars, the on site trinkets shop, the cleanliness were all brilliant - the only let down was the 'west meets east' evening meal menu - it was pricey but alas very average - just bland flavour - filled our hunger BUT did not excite our taste buds. We will eat out on a evening - but would we use this hotel again = YES. Tram no.4 terminus is 2 minutes away so is perfect way to get into the city centre...

Reviews.Title: “A Place for Serenity on Holiday”
Reviews.Author: OnlyChatru
Reviews.Content: It is located approximately 15 minutes by train away from the Schipol Airport through RAI station and 15 minutes by taxi to the downtown Amsterdam. Technically situated in between Airport and the City. The staffs are prompt are professionally equipped to assist guest. Since the hotel is just across the conventions RAI Convention Centre, most of the guest are attending exhibitions. It is just a 100 meters away from the tram and train station heading to metropolitan and airport (train). The building is huge outside and we got a room for three but I was surprise it was too small for three occupants. To think that the third person has to sleep in the pull-out couch, there is no space for the rest to move around. The view from the room's window was very lovely. The room is clean and tidy with complete entertainments facility, however the internet (wifi) is not available in the room but a network port with charge. There are 4 installed unit of stand-alone pc available in the lobby for free use of internet access. What is fabulous in this hotel is the buffet! What a surprise. Very impressive settings and the variants of foods available for the guests on breakfast. Total Impression was Great Stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the RAI and transport links”
Reviews.Author: Richanddee
Reviews.Content: The hotel, was efficient and in walking distance from public transport and the RAI convention centre. The room was large and in good order. Breakfast was good with a wide choice.

Reviews.Title: “Style???”
Reviews.Author: Mirela28
Reviews.Content: My option for city break in Amsterdam was Novotel City. Is well conected with for city center ( tram 4 near ) and for airport ( RAI ). Good breakfast, nice room, clean. We choose notsmoking room from thursday to sunday. Friday evening in our room was smoke from an other room conected by a close dor with our room. Saturday morning same but we left fast our room to visit the town. In the evening 10 pm was not posble to breaf without to open the window. I called to reception and a lady told me that she will send somebody to check. After 30 min. nothing. I called again and same she told me that somebody will came. After other 20 min. I called again and a gay told me that they check the corridor and everithing ok. My opinion that they need a psiholog because when somebody claim a problem in his room you cannot go to solve this problem to corridor, restaurant, parking............ After 1 hour was 23 pm came a gay who told that is smell from smoking in our room and gave us other room. Somebody smoke near our room in notsmoking room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, clean, quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: The2explorers28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Amsterdam for 1 night at the end of October. We booked this hotel as it was good value for money and had very good reviews on here. It perfectly suited our needs as it was clean, comfortable and in a quiet location. It also had good connections to the centre on Tram 4 which stopped only a 100 or so metres away. Free WiFi in the rooms was a bonus. We tend to prefer modern hotels and this was exactly what we got with the Novotel Amsterdam - it is very attractively decorated, the foyer in particular. The rooms were reasonably sized and the bed very comfortable.The staff were helpful and efficient. We couldn't fault it for what it costs and it certainly exceeded expectations, we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast, free wifi”
Reviews.Author: ast2000
Reviews.Content: Even the room is a lit bit little, the other facts are very satisfactory. The breakfast buffet is very good, there are nearly everything someone wants. The waiters are very kind and helpful. There is free wifi in the rooms and free desktops in reception. You can easily reach to hotel from Schipol airport with train. Also you can use tram line 4 for going to city center and you can connect the trams to go other places.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time”
Reviews.Author: Flip/Binkle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in October and really enjoyed it. It isnt difficult to reach the hotel from the Airport. People have already covered how to do this so I wont detail it here. The city centre is approximately 20 minutes away on Tram Line 4 and it was simple and cheap to use. We bought a 3 day ticket on the first day and that was all our transportation costs taken care of (apart from the airport). Just a quick point, if you are planning on going to the Heineken Experience, this is actually passed on your way into the centre. I can't fault the hotel in any way really. Breakfast was amazing and included with our booking, which Iam really pleased with. The room was clean, comfortable and well equipped. Apart from breakfast we didnt actual eat or drink in the hotel because we eat in the centre, so im afraid I cant help out much there. The staff were nice and helpful. If your looking for somewhere to base yourself for a series of long wild nights out in Amsterdam city centre then this probably isnt the hotel for you. Because its not a central location you will probably have to get a taxi back if its late. But it was perfect for us and allowed us to investigate the city over the 3 days. If I was coming back to Amsterdam again and could get a similar price, I wouldnt even bother looking for another hotel, Id just stay here again and not give it a moments thought.

Reviews.Title: “Why there?”
Reviews.Author: Mslavina
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Novotel, the only thing amiss is plastic cups in the rooms instead of glasses, however inexpensive. Location is a problem however. It's in south Amsterdam, half an hour's drive from the centre, next to the Zuid station. You can get there direct from Schiphol airport either by train or by car, no need to go to the centre at all. It is supposed to be close to the train station, but it isn't really, not if you've got any luggage. The business district of Zuidas is a 20-minute vigorous walk. The hotel is basically in the middle of nowhere, with just residential streets around it. Not even a shopping centre really close, no next door restaraunts or cafes or anything. Why they built it there I can't understand. If you're there for the business district, try the Crown Plaza, or maybe Hilton or the one across the street from it -- its a much shorter walk.

Reviews.Title: “The dutch beauty”
Reviews.Author: vicky686
Reviews.Content: novotel looks a new place in the city and is a spacious and an big place for normally what we get in europe. I thought the place is good and rooms really spacious. The hotel may be outside the city but the Ra 1 stn tram no 4 ends outside the hotel door. So is absolutely no problem commuting from city. the hotel has a great ambinece and food as well. The restaurant is beautifully done and the staff was pretty cordial and efficient. must say looks quite an posh place as compared to other older hotels in the city. All rooms are no smoking but can try some luck if windows are open. WI FI is FOC!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Watash9
Reviews.Content: For a 4* hotel I was very disappointed with the room. It should be a 2* hotel! The rooms were small and the interior was horrible. It was very dark and cold. I was so disappointed with the room that I asked the hotel manager if I could be moved to a different room. I also thought they would compliment me because it was my birthday, but they said that all the rooms were the same. I could not believe it. I was upset because I thought the layout of the room would be similar to the one in Birmingham. Nonetheless, the only thing I liked about the hotel was some of the staff. The service was swift, they were happy and helpful. Particularly the breakfast staff and cleaners.

Reviews.Title: “Good value just outside the city”
Reviews.Author: Pharmatraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while vacationing with my spouse in Amsterdam. The room was clean, quite and well stocked. While the hotel seems far from city center, it is a is very easy walk to the RAI train station. That makes it easy access from the Central train station, the Schipol Airport and City Center (3 separate systems that all meet there). The center of the city can be reached within 15-20 minutes using the city Tram #4 and you can buy the ticket on the tram (7 Euro for 24 hr pass) and use on any tram to get all over the city. You can take the tram to the "DAM" stop and then walk to the Anne Frank huis (house). The Airport train is 2.60 Euro and you MUST have coins not paper money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: KarenTurek
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. During the check-in the frontdesk guy was adorable and fast. Hotel can be easily accessed from the airport or city centre by car/train/metro/bus. The station is a about 10-15 minutes walk. The room was spacious and comfortable with a good and big bed and pillows. Very calm, quiet and clean hotel. The breakfast, lunch and dinner were nice and diversified. Hotel provides internet at the hotel's lobby and rooms. Overall facilities were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Westgalady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Novotel for four nights last week while I was touring Amsterdam. It has beautiful well kept rooms, the lobby is beautiful, the breakfast is EXCELLENT, and everyone working there was helpful and friendly. This hotel is a five minute walk to the RAI Metro station which can take you any place in Amsterdam. Although this is the perfect hotel, it is fairly far out of the mainstream of activities of the older part of Amsterdam. It took me a 25-30 minute metro ride each day just to get to where the tours start and the best shopping and restaurants are located. If you expect to spend a lot of time near Central Station then you might be better off looking for a hotel in that area. I guess it just depends on your personal tastes. For my next trip to Amsterdam I am going to get a hotel near the Van Gogh Museum and use that area as a stepping off point for tours.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Didier C
Reviews.Content: Nice and welcoming hotel located quite well. Amsterdam centre is reachable by tramway (25 min trip). Warm and welcoming staff... Nice food and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Mayberries
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight as part of a tour of Europe. Hotel was clean, had been renovated and updated. Staff were friendly, welcoming. Buffet Breakfast was better than expected, lots of variety. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “J's Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year. Service and food here are nice. Specially, breakfast is awesome. Only thing that I am not satisfied is the price. They keep raising price every year. We will decrease exhibition staffs because of high price for the next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ufgator27
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this place a lot! Super friendly, fast, bright, welcoming, ...fantastic! The towels are on the thin side and the rug is on the worn side (I always bring socks for hotels anyway tho). Room service great and friendly and articulate! Food better than average, not outstanding but nice and perfectly acceptable. Perfect for business stays in amstelveen!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money or hassle, sub-par at best”
Reviews.Author: Ruddyone
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel is no where near worth it. The rooms were just ok. They were clean but small. The hotel is not in the city center but they charge like it were. The food at the restaurant was also just ok. Nothing to write home about. The bar closed early. Check-in was slow and the wireless access hardly worked in the meeting rooms. What really frustrated me though (and the reason for my rating) was their cancellation policy. I had booked 6 nights. When I arrived I informed the staff that I would only be staying for 4 nights as I had some other meetings come up in another city. Regardless of what I said, they insisted on charging me for the full 6 night booking. Even though while I stood there, they turned others away. I'm sure that they charged me for the room and are now renting to others making double their money. Sub-par room and food plus the way they treated me at the end left me with a bad taste. I will never go there again and certainly would recommend others to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would book again”
Reviews.Author: chipmunky
Reviews.Content: Very close to the RAF train station, had a problem locating where the hotel was at first because there were no signs anywhere, just turn right and carry on walking up, it is next to the Holiday Inn hotel. The hotel is very nice on the inside and the outside too. The lobby area is very pretty, staff were very pleasant, that goes for reception and housekeeping staff - Special mention to the housekeeping staff, they were alwyas smiley and said good morning to us each day :) For those who need to use the Internet for checking on emails, online check in etc they have computers down at the lobby for guests to use. You can also print things out as well, free of charge, I felt this was very good as some of the hotels I go to charges you for wifi and printing etc. The room was an OK size for a twin room, beds were comfy, clean room and bathroom. We had a nice view in our room ,especially at night, but then again we didn't go to Amsterdam to stare out the bedroom window. The hotel is located ..... around 15-20mins tram ride from the city centre. The tram operates frequently, it takes you straight to the centre. We didn't eat in the restaurant so I cannot comment on that, but if you fancy trying something else, there are restaurant close by the hotel, just 10-15 minutes walk away, There are quite a few, ranging from Korean, Japanese, Chinese Italian to English. If you prefer a hotel near the centre then maybe this hotel isn't so suitable for you, but if you don't mnid the tram rides, or if you are there for business then this is the perfect hotel! Things to improve on: Move the leaflet stand to the reception area! The leaflet stand was on the far end by the lifts and we was looking for a map for days! We managed to see it on the last day but it wasn't so much in eye view it may as well not be there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: nic21wales
Reviews.Content: Large modern hotel- very clean. Quick easy check-in. Deposit of â‚¬70 paid by cash/ credit card for extras- refunded upon check out if nothing used. Friendly staff. We had superior room- double bed and sofa bed. Mini bar, tv, free wifi access from room. Spacious bathroom. Did not use restaurant, but 24hour room service also available. Vending and ice machines available. Good location- 2 min walk from rai station, which runs directly to and from schipol airport. Next to rai is also tram stop- Number 4 takes you to central station passing through dam square. 24hr tram passes â‚¬7, very handy! Would definately return here for our next trip to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Good friendly service, accessible by train plain, automobile and tram.”
Reviews.Author: FritsO
Reviews.Content: After a good reception, the room was changed to facilitate my lack of mobility, without a fuss in a quiet and efficient way. Disabled access is good with assistance available where needed. The food is freshly cooked, well presented and caters for a world wide pallet, with fast efficient and friendly service by all staff. Beds are over size and comfortable, for someone over six foot, like myself.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: swisstraveller2010
Reviews.Content: It is a very functional hotel, closae to the center city, not really cosy, typical business hotel, service is good, food nothing really great

Reviews.Title: “Great location for RAI, good service, light amenities”
Reviews.Author: BillShepp
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is one of two hotels located next to the Amsterdam RAI train station adjacent to the RAI Conference Center (an easy two-stop 11-minute â‚¬3 ride from Schiphol airport). If you're attending a conference there it's a great location. If you're planning to tour central Amsterdam it's well-connected via both train and GVB, but you won't be able to walk to any particularly charming neighborhoods. There is bike rental at the nearby train station, it would be a delightful ride on the many bike paths to city center. The hotel facility is not at all modern, but has been updated to a reasonable level. The rooms are basic but functional. Wireless is free, and measured at 2Mbit, though often dropped significantly. Wired is also available for about â‚¬6, the front desk said performance is somewhat better than wireless. My standard room had a shower (no tub), be careful of the flow of the water as it created quite a flood on the bathroom floor the first time I used it. Amenities are limited - shampoo, no conditioner. There were two washcloths (not always standard in Europe) when I checked in, but they weren't replaced. The TV provides a variety of channels in English and other major European languages, but does not provide CNN International or other American news/financial channels. There is a full-service restaurant which offers two menus, one with traditional European food, the other with Asian fusion. Food was reasonably tasty and reasonably priced. I didn't have their breakfast (â‚¬21 if not included in the room). In short, a perfectly fine place to stay for business, and for tourism if you don't mind commuting in to the central city.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Kbochick
Reviews.Content: This was our first Novotel, and we thought it was great. Nothing spectacular, but quite good. Parking is right out front (which isn't always the case for European hotels), which is a big bonus. The room was great for our family of three, and our daughter's breakfast was free. Breakfast was also a pretty impressive spread. It's not right downtown, but it's very close to a tram station, and the tram will take you straight to the main train station, so it was quite convenient. We were amazed at how many languages they spoke there. The breakfast manager alone spoke 5 or 6.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: GC61
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 5 year-old son stayed here in mid-August for 2 nights. We were on a room-only basis which was good value as there was a sofa-bed in the room in which my son slept. The hotel has a modern entrance and foyer and the restaurants look very nice. However, the rooms - at least the one we stayed in - are a little dated with the carpet frayed in parts and could generally do with a small freshening up. We didn't eat in the hotel on either of the nights we were there so I cannot comment on the restaurants. At 21.50 euros each we avoided the breakfast buffet. However, there do not appear to be any obvious cafes around, so we bought croissants for breakfast at the little shop in Rai train station about 5 minutes walk away. As mentioned by other reviewers, the tram stop is the quickest way to the city centre and is only about 5 minutes walk from the hotel and beside the train station. Note also if you are travelling from Schipol to get the train going to Amsterdam Zuid, where Rai I think is the second stop, rather than going in the direction of Amsterdam Cantraal. For those travelling with children Amstel park, across the road from the hotel, is well worth a visit and there is an excellent playground there amongst other attractions. Overall I would happily stay here again when visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: vk167
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent hotel. The staff was extraordinarily polite and courteous and went out of way to allow us an early check in. The property is very well maintained with nice rooms. It is very well connected by tram and railway. Both stations are less than 5 minute walking. On the negative side, the breakfast is too expensive and the hotel is a bit far from the central area. However, on the whole as a family we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, location not too far too”
Reviews.Author: SoumitreeG
Reviews.Content: firstly it's not bang in the city/ city-center but around 15 mins away from it by tram, but then again it's right next to the RAI station, so getting to center of town is never an issue. also, there are always some cabs waiting in the hotel foyer. rooms - very nice and has most things. comfy bed, clean linen, extra linen, mini-bar, comfy chairs, sofa, wi-fi, etc. bathrooms are quite nice n spacious too. a nice touch was the tv screen welcoming u with your name on it as soon as u switch it on. breakfast spread in the morning was also very nice. check-in was quick and efficient. there are slef check-in/checl-out kiosks too. only thing i was a bit pissed at 1st day was when i called at 1000 hrs and asked till what time breakfast was being served they said it closes at 0930 hrs...whereas it was a saturday and they close breakfasts at 1030 on wknds! so that was not fair on the part of that gent. also, once i came back to the hotel at 0430 hrs (Sat Aug 20 morning) and had to keep ringing the bell for 2-3 mins before the gent on duty scrambled back to his desk from somewhere! this would have been nastier if it was the cold season. but overall, very nice n decent hotel and got it at bargain price. i sure would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: hariister
Reviews.Content: We are 3 friends on a leisure trip to Amsterdam for a weekend and we chose this hotel because it can accommodate 3 in a room (1 double bed + 1 sofa bed). The hotel is nicely refurbished with contemporary furnitures, modern & sleek in the lobby (with free computer terminals & free Wifi hotel wide); and nice & simple in the room. We got our room at a very good rate which includes complimentary breakfast for all of us (it costs â‚¬22.50 per pax). We love the air-conditioned room in summer, shower & bathtub in room with basic amenities, but sufficient. Our shower head was not working well on first day, it was fixed the next day morning and the hotel staff actually stop by to ask if everything is ok, which is a nice gesture. The hotel is situated right next to a broad major road but the traffic from street is not affecting us in the room (we're on 4-th floor). It's less than 5 minutes walk from metro/tram/train station (RAI). From airport, it takes 7 minutes train to hotel; and tram4 travels to city centre at 10mins interval, total journey takes 10 - 15 minutes (depending on where you get off). We checked in early, and as we leave our luggage, the very friendly staff gave us some maps, showed us the major attraction areas, gave us restaurant recommendations, and even provide us with public transport time table (tram & night bus) with detail description. Big breakfast buffet area with nice spread (love their made to order omelettes) and reasonable quality. Novotel handles a large number of guests (get the impression from breakfast crowd), and they're doing a good job. The only down side with such high occupancy rate hotel is lift/elevator capacity. There are 4 elevators but at 'rush hour', it is not enough to handle all crowds, but no problem for us, just take the next available one :) It is a bit outside of city center but that's why we get much more room space for the price we pay. Amsterdam is not a huge city, a 10 minutes tram ride will already land you somewhere very happening, totally not an issue for us. I'd stay with Novotel again if I travel with friends.

Reviews.Title: “rooms need refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: yesaurabh
Reviews.Content: Its a hotel of contrast. Looks grand, contemporary and very modern when you enter. Its got a big lobby, nice sitting and waiting area, big breakfast room. However when you take the lift to any floors it depicts a slightly different story. Not so clean carpets, very basic rooms with mediocre beds. I have stayed in much better 4 star hotels in Amsterdam at a cheaper price than this. Overall Novotel Amsterdam is a decent hotel, but its room price and the 4 star tag is simply not justified.

Reviews.Title: “Very good base in Amsterdam no frills”
Reviews.Author: Cdneurotravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times on business , the hotel is quite straight forward, clean newer rooms, free wifi. strong breakfast buffet ( a bit pricey @22 euro) The only objection is evening meals or room service, food quality is generally good when it arrives. I have waited 1 hr cor room service, also received the wrong order, and had major items missing( ie main). Thinking this was a room service issue similar things happened when I ate in restaurant - were wifi doesn't work. But overall good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with Resonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Only 200 meters from Amsterdam RAI station, public transportation is very convenient. 11 min to Schiphol airport by train. My 9 y/o boy likes its sofa bed. Among several Novotel we stayed, this Novotel is a big one, with a large lobby. If not for business, weekend price will be much more attrative.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location not great”
Reviews.Author: KatieDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: Do Describe the service you experienced Tell us how you liked the room Talk about the location & amenities Say what you liked best & least The travel from the airport to the hotel was convenient and cheap with a half hour train journey to the centre then a tram ride for another 15-20 minutes. From the tram station, the hotel is a 5 minutes walk. The surrounding areas is not very appealing as it's next to dual carriageways so it feels like the hotel has been built on a motorway. The reception lobby looks the same as the ones from the hotel - modern / contemporary The staff were friendly enough There were 3 of us ladies sharing a family room which meant there wasn't much space (or mirrors) to get ready. Rooms were basic and clean but the price included breakfast for 3 of us so it was value for money. The breakfast was brilliant - there were tepenyaki style chefs on hand to cook your eggs, i.e. omelette, fried egg etc we didn't experience constant traffic noise however we did hear a few car horns during the night - great if you're not a light sleeper If you are planning on staying out late then I wouldn't recommend staying here as a taxi ride could be expensive (we were on the last tram back - around midnight?). There is a train station next to the tram station - to get to the same central destination, we found that the train (15 mins) was slightly faster than the tram (20-25m) so if they are both running, use the train. I would only recommend staying here if the purpose of the trip is to sight see, daytime / evening activities, and of course, business! We didn't use a taxi so i'm not 100% sure on the cost however it would be at least a 20 minute ride from the central station. whereas the 2 day tram/train ticket was around 5euro each I'm returning to Amsterdam in September 2011 however we are planning to stay out late so we've booked a place in the centre instead. We didn't choose to stay here again as we may save money on room prices but we'd have to pay more for travel as there are 6 of us this time

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and bright!”
Reviews.Author: happytravelling50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not exactly in the city centre! It takes approx 20 minutes by tram to get to the centre of Amsterdam. Check in took ages and we were told to come back some time around 4.00pm as the rooms hadn't all been cleaned. To be fair, the hotel reception was very busy. When we returned at approx 4.00pm the room was ready for us. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean, there's a safe in the room, a mini-bar and a hair-dryer in the bathroom. The food in the restaurant seemed expensive but compared to the rest of Amsterdam it's comparable. (the average meal is approx Â£15 in the restaurant, in the centre of Amsterdam a meal costs anything from Â£10, expect to pay around Â£4.50 or more for a pint!) We had a good time and I'd stay at this hotel again as even though it's busy our room was quiet. When needed, luggage can be stored safely, it's kept in a locked room with someone in there and picked up with a ticket receipt they give you for each bag, this service was invaluable on the day of departure as we were able to go off sightseeing and collect our luggage when it was finally time to go, this stopped us having to carry luggage around with us all that day..The tram and train is a few minutes walk away, buy a ticket that lasts for as long as your visit and save money, if you buy a ticket from day to day it works out more expensive. Overall, a pleasant experience!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Amst - I experienced wonderful service. Cheers”
Reviews.Author: Nikhil_shimpi
Reviews.Content: I had visited Amst with my few of my business colleagues for a leisure trip in June 2011. The hotel is located besides the Rai convention center with good Tram and Rail connectivity. I found the rooms very well appointed and functional. The Breakfast spread was top class. I also want to narrate another experience which "wow" ed me. I happen to forget my jacket in my room on checkout and only realised it when I reached my home country. but i found the hotel staff extremely helpful in locating my jacket and also organising to send it back to me in my country. I will always remember this gesture. Kudos to the team.. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for walk to RAI”
Reviews.Author: foundbythewater
Reviews.Content: There was a delay waiting for our room--one was not available on arrival but the wait was less than an hour. The location was very convenient for a short walk to the RAI for conference. It was not close to other attractions but the tram was very close, ran frequently and got us near our locations. The hotel itself was fairly standard-chain hotel atmosphere but had free internet on lobby computers. For business, I'd stay again but for pleasure I'd likely look for a hotel closer to attractions, especially near the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was having a refurb?”
Reviews.Author: peaches032
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two years ago and there were signs everywhere suggesting a super refurb - what happened? Lobby, restaurant and rooms all still the same! Lobby nice sorry and user friendly Restaurants - slow service, nice food Rooms - tired, dirty, lumpy beds, no duvets

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel & it's associates!”
Reviews.Author: Travelmore63
Reviews.Content: Well, where to start........ I went here on business years ago and while service was friendly it was in need of renovation. When returning for a family visit I was really pleasantly surprised to find the they renovated from top to bottom. From the arrival to the lobby to the rooms they basically transformed the hotel. I love the fact that they are close to the city center yet conveniently located on the south side of Amsterdam. Easy transportaion to airport too. Had great breakfasts here as well as dinner unlike most hotels. Hotel has a good vibe. Love the free wireless too. They must have steady management because everyone I encountered was very helpful and friendly. We'll be back! Thes

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for RIA”
Reviews.Author: GordyMac
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel whilst attending the CineEurope convention at the RIA. Hotel is 10 minute walk to the convention centre and is therefore very handy. Also close to the railway station making connections very easy. The Hotel ground floor has been refurbished since i last stayed and it is very good, great improvement. Room was standard, nothing wrong but nothing special. Bed was comfy so no issues. Free wi-fi was a welcome inclusion. Breakfast was extra on my room rate and definelty not work the cost, the choice was good but there is no justification for â‚¬21.50. More than happy to stay there again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Kingdom of Arrogance”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 30 minutes check-in time? Extremely slow service during dinner? Arrogant, untrained staff? Novotel Amsterdam standards. If you experience the same problems do not be stupid to report it to the duty manager or GM. They are even worse. Nobody will listen to you. They simply do not care. They will start blaming you for everything that had happened to you. And to be honest they are right. I have made a huge mistake when I chose this hotel. Stay away from the kingdom of arrogance!

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous attitude re Pricing and commercial inflexibility”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very dissatisfied with the lack of commercial attitude and unflexibility. The "promotionnal" price I had initially booked through the website for my 1st night (a Sunday, when the hotel was almost empty), was eventually increased by â‚¬60 just because I came to attend a conference. And the so-called conference price for the rest of the stay was discounted by less than 10% of the public full price obtained from the Accor website. So overall I only saved â‚¬10 on a â‚¬800 hotel bill for attending the conference: absolutely ridiculous and the worst thing is that there was NO WAY to discuss or speak to a supervisor (in spite of my asking there were just repeating like robots "sorry this is not possible"), to get the price for that 1st night back to its initial price. It's a shame as other than that the hotel offers good standards (but obviously not cheap!) That was a very ill advised attitude from the Novotel reception staff. Accor should know that they're not going to see me before long in their hotels and that I have widely publicized the story to friends and social networks I'm part of, and also let the organizers of the conference in my company know abt this and my dissatisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “The lobby is very nice”
Reviews.Author: lsfSeattle
Reviews.Content: They've recently renovated the lobby, and it shows. It has a "modern Dutch design" feel complete with molded plastic furniture and bright green tones. The restaurant and breakfast buffet are also very nice (which is good, because there's very little else around). Fortunately, the Metro is close, and you can get to the city in a flash, as well as connect to trains all over. But the room, while not bad, had a constant smell of mold (from the bathroom) and barely room to store our suticases. The bed was one of the hardest I've ever slept in (a plus if you like a hard bed, but I don't). Keep in mind, this was one of the more expensive rooms in the property. We tried to spend as much time as possible outside of our room, since the mold aggravated my allergies. I was happy for the free wi-fi; however, it went out quite often - once, we had to ask the staff to correct it 3 times before they got it to work again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position and wonderful breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Appkiller
Reviews.Content: It's near Station RAI that is 2 stops from Schipol Airport and where the Tram n.4 leave fro the center of the city (25 min) so it's located in an excellent position for business trip and also to visit the city (Tram n.4 leaves the city center at maximum half past midnight). the hotel is pretty new - very clean and confortable; wonderfull breakfast in the morning with all you could expect: from all cookies species to the real american breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and child friendly”
Reviews.Author: SamInSingapore
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable nice hotel. Although located further out from city center, it is conveniently only a 10-15 minute ride into the heart of the city (Central Station) from the tram terminus, which is ~250 meters from the hotel entrance. From Central Station, there are convenient connections to every major attraction in Amsterdam. Hotel has a very child friendly policy compared to most other hotels. We chose this hotel because our 8 year old son's stay and breakfast came at no extra cost. We were pleasantly surprised when, in addition, he was given chocolate treats and coloring sheets to keep him happy at breakfast. Not much recreational facility here, though, except for a small room with an X-box. Sadly, it was not working throughout our 10 day stay, and none of the staff we asked could get it working so we gave up after several attempts. Nonetheless, it was an enjoyable stay and great value for money especially for a family with a young child.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cool lobby and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Suited our three days stay in Amsterdam perfectly. Close to tramstation, 15 min ride to center, quiet location, nothing to see in the neighborhood. Breakfast was ok, but there was a line to get in the restaurant friday and saturday morning. Dined in hotel first night, ok but nothing more than ok. Free use of Mac in the lobby, free wirelees in hotel room. In room and hallway the carpets neeeds a change.

Reviews.Title: “the service was overaal really bad, especially at the reception and hotelbar”
Reviews.Author: nanceb1
Reviews.Content: Checkin is from 12.00, we all got our rooms at 16.00!! and no appologie, or complementary drink or anything. We just had to deal with very unfriendly staf.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: EddyBull
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend work conference (Friday to Sunday). Firstly, the conference facilities were excellent, as was the in-conferencde catering (coffees, cakes biscuits, etc). Unfortunately, the same cannot be said of the rest of the hotel. My room was clean but there were a few old stains on the carpet. It was quite basic, but as expected from a Novotel. But the worst, and most surprising aspect, was the food, it was absolutely dreadful. We had a curry one evening and it was inedible - the naan was cold and hard, the rice cold and the curry like something from a tin. The dessert was carrot pudding (!!) and to be frank, it looked like vomit. Breakfast was fine (difficult to go wrong with cereal, salami, cheese and bread) but lunch and dinner in the restaurants was awful. The staff, however, particularly in the breakfast restaurant, were very helpful and always smiling. The hotel is also a bit on its own with nothing near, no bars etc. There is a lovely park opposite if you fancy a wander. The cheese toasties at the mini-golf cafe in the park were far better than the lunchtime offering at the hotel! It's quite a way from the centre of the city (I think we paid â‚¬16 for a taxi in the evening) but a pleasant 10/15 minunte ride on the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons are debating”
Reviews.Author: jude9999
Reviews.Content: My experience there 2 nights were totally a mix!!! Pros: location is good, near RAI metro/ rainway station. The variety of breakfast is good and fresh, waiters were very good in the breakfast hall. The check-out recieption, a lady was very professional, the company forgot to pay for us, the lady in Novotel solved it in a good way. The desk could be customised nice. Cons:the wifi was not working at all, and after several calls, they sent me a 190cm guy standing out side of my room, like "what's up?" , very very unfriendly. I asked for breakfast in room and told them through call, but they did not pick up the card. Bathroom could be better in terms of hair in bath and tower (if we look very carefully). There was only 4 public PCs to use in the hall, we have to queue to use the internet. I also recommend the management team in Novotel to let the receiption staff sit down, they are standing all day long, can be very very tired, and no wonder sometimes they can not deliver top service to guests.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Lets Itself Down - Don't stay if you want a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: a1001
Reviews.Content: I was bookend in at this hotel due to it's proximity to RAI which was a 5-10 min walk. It is also convenient for the train from Schipol. Sadly check-in was really slow.
