Despite counting 9 staff on the desks (they seem to insist on having two people for each checkin desk!) there were only 2 desks open causing a 10 minute wait. I had a room on the top floor which was clean and comfortable. Sadly only the ground floor seemed to be airconditioned with the controls in the room making no difference. You can open the window slightly which helps but then you have the noise of the busy road nearby and also hotel guests drinking and smoking outside the front entrance until early in the morning. For these reasons I had poor sleep for both nights I was staying and therefore I would recommend that you avoid the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly out of town but so, so worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Matt6825
Reviews.Content: I visited Amsterdam with two friends and the three of us shared a room. There was a double bed and a sofa bed. I slept on the sofa bed and it was extremely comfortable. The hotel is really modern and super clean throughout. Wifi is free and works everywhere in the hotel. If you havent a laptop or a device to use the wifi theres free computers to use which run both Safari or Internet Explorer. Plus if you need to print anything like boarding passes from the airport you can print from these computer free of charge. The breakfast is worth having as its fantastic, fresh with a large selection. Full english to cereal, fresh fruit to cooked meats, cheeses and breads. I have two things I wasnt 100% happy with. First, the location is slightly out of the city centre, however it cost 2.90euros on the tram which is right outside the hotel to get into the city centre. Also, staying on the location, its great for catching the train from the airport. It took 10 minutes and cost around 3.50euros. Also on an evening we used taxis to get back from the centre which cost between 16-20euros for three of us. My second gripe is that it was quite warm in the rooms at night. We had the window open and the air conditioning on full but we were still too hot. It was warm outside, around 25 degrees in the day and there were three of us in the room so this may be not have helped. To sum up, this is great hotel and I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Very glad I stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Out of town”
Reviews.Author: DukeOfCumberland
Reviews.Content: I can understand why people stay at the airport, for convenience, or in the centre to be close to the action, but why would you take the train two stops into the middle of a business estate, with a half hour tram ride to get near anything. Once was interesting, but after that it was a real chore. I was there for a conference. Glad I wasn't paying. The buffet food that was provided was almost inedible. The bar prices reflected the lack of competition. If you want a cheap bed in the sticks then fine, if you want to be near the action, forget it.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: darshitmehta1
Reviews.Content: novotel amsterdam was a great place to dig in.the art noveaux hotel has plush colors that gives a feeling of warmth.the staff was exceptional and welcoming.600 rooms to choose from was a huge variety offered.the breakfast was very good with a lot of variety.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer8811
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were greeted by the reception staff and quickly given our room keys. The downstairs restaurant and bar area are very modern - really nice. Our room was lovely the furniture was all modern and a nice welcome message on the lcd TV. The rooms need a little updating e.g. new carpets/curtains. Apart from that it was perfect. If you want to explore amsterdam this hotel is a little out of the way, however there is a tram station about 5 minuets walk from the hotel. Room service - though pricey is well worth it. Although we ordered 2 coffees in the morning and a full breakfast was brought and we were still charged for it! The staff are friendly and the sights are nice. We didnt have a room with a view so id reccomend requesting one as the back of the hotel overlooks more buildings.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay”
Reviews.Author: John0103 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Generally great experience all round, friendly staff and good service. Very close to the University and the RAI station - only a couple of stops from the airport. This is my fourth stay and its always perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Hotel was pretty good”
Reviews.Author: NLCPleasanton_CA
Reviews.Content: I had some reservations about the hotel reading it was a distance from the center of Amsterdam. We stayed 2 night. and would return again. We found our way from the airport without difficulties and getting into Amsterdam Central was easy as well. The hotel is literally 1 1/2 block from the hotel. The buffet breakfast was good as well. We had a nice, quiet room as requested. The only down side was there weren't any restaurants close to the hotel, but you have endless possibilities in town.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Lyndsay1989
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel in October with work. Mainley a business hotel and not in the best area if you are travelling for pleasure! As you enter the hotel it is very trendy but computers that are free to use in the lobby were never working. Rooms were the usual nice Novotel standard, nice big windows let in plenty of light though! Bathroom is much in need of being updated! The Novotel UK hotels I have stayed in have amazing showers and this one just soaked the floor and dribbled on me. Its a funky hotel down stairs and compared to alot of the hotels in City very modern! If you can id pay extra and go to the Grand Sofitel!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel 3 min walk 2 tram”
Reviews.Author: rols95
Reviews.Content: I Stayed In This Hotel For 3 NIGHTS With My Husband And Another couple The Hotel Was First Class We could NOT COMPLAIN /////////// ROOMS were CLEAN AND VERY COMFORTABLE BREAKFAST Included ANYTHING YOU WANTED!!!!!!! Ok the LOCATION IS NOT GREAT BUT 3 MINS WALKS U 2 THE tram which goes EVERY 20 mins AND THEN IT ONLY TAKES ABOUT 25 MINS 2 City centre. Cost of Tram is Very cheap U Can get A Weekend ticket.THE Quality of the hotel really made our holiday staff were all so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Too Expensive”
Reviews.Author: NowBoarding05
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a short walk from the metro station and it is easy to get to, even though it is outside of the city. Seemed to be in a safe area and was quiet at night. The rooms were clean and spacious. The internet was expensive and so was the food. This hotel is just an average place, nothing luxurious - it is overpirced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cestovatel_W
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located outside the city in-fact, just on the A-dam ring. If you are by car it's a great location (because you can park a car near the hotel for free at night, but hotel's parking costs 20 eur / hight or more, don't remember), but if you are without car it would be really comlicated to get to city center. A room was very basic, clean, but not cozy or really comfortable. Public areas and lobby are really impressive and modern, there is free internet in the lobby, but in room only with charge. Breakfast was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for professional purpose”
Reviews.Author: LilRedFrog
Reviews.Content: If you're coming to Amsterdam to visit the city, please choose another hotel. However, if you're attending a trade show at the RAI of Amsterdam, this will be the hotel you want to go for. It's a 10 minutes walk to the RAI with the station just in between the two. The room I had was very clean and comfortable enough. Not very spacious but I spent there only a night (arriving after midnight and leaving before 10 the next day) so it was spacious enough. The staff is VERY friendly (and I can be quite picky when it comes to that), for some, it might seem a bit "too" friendly. The lobby and bar/restaurants are very clean too as well as design and modern (unlike the floors that still feel like you took a time machine and ended in 1975). The outside of the hotel also offers absolutely no interest whatsoever, but then again, you don't go there for the leisure. Continental breakfast is very good too (and here again I can be VERY picky). I have no idea of the price since I had to stay there on a business night and it was all paid by my company but in any case, it is a hotel I would recommend if you're there only on a business trip and aren't planning on leaving the RAI/hotel very much. BUT, as much as I would not advice this hotel if you want to visit the city, it is very easy to reach the heart of Amsterdam by simply taking the train from RAI station to Amsterdam Centraal and go to a nice restaurant, spend the day or go for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: going-around-10
Reviews.Content: This novotel is not at the best location if you're a tourist. Next time, I'd prefer to stay close to tourist area, although tram 4 is just next to the hotel and in 20 min you're in the main streets of Amsterdam. So if was not a huge problem after all. The only thing is that it has no restaurants around and you get to eat at the restaurant of the hotel, which was reaaly nice. Too crowded because there is a conference center nearby, but they managed to serve very efficiently. The staff eas very helpful. We arrived in the middle of a blackout in he whole block and they did their best to accomodate us. The elevators worked and we just stayed in our rooms until the lights were on again. My niece was sick when we arrived and one of the staff people, jayme was very nice trying to help us. He was very concerned and asked how she was the othe days and offered to help if we needed anything. Very nice of him. Also a Brazilian man of the staff, Ruy I think, was very nice and helpful. The blanket of the pull-out sofa bed where my nephew slept was very dirty, obvioulsy not changed since the last guest. I complained with him and took note of that to verify it. I think they should pay attention more carefully to the cleaning of the rooms because of this. I'm sure this is not a regular event in this hotel. Wifi internet was free of charge which was very nice and unusual for a novotel. I'd like if other novotels would do the same. Breakfast was very good!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - but not central to the City”
Reviews.Author: stacey_holloway
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel Amersterdam City for a work conference in October 2010 and it was lovely. The rooms were spacious and clean, with all mod cons. They were cleaned daily, and the staff could not have been friendlier. When I first checked in, my room smelt of smoke (despite the whole hotel being non smoking and signs being on the doors) so I asked to switch roms. The staff could not have been more apologetic (even though it wasn't their fault!)and moved me immediately. The conferencing facilities were excellent. We had a buffet dinner one night and a set menu the next; all the food was really delicious and nicely cooked. Breakfasts were also great - huge choice and good quality. The only negative for this hotel is that it's not in the city centre. It's only about a 5 minute walk to the trains/trams so is very easily accessible from Schipol or the City, but you do need to take a train to get in - it's about a 15/20 minute tram ride. In the evenings, we took taxis which cost about â‚¬30. Overall, highly recommended for conferences/work; but personally if I was a tourist in Amsterdam I would want to be closer to the city centre to avoid having to take taxis or public transport to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & Comfortable, Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ansh9899
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this Hotel. The hotel was booked by my host in Amsterdam and I thanked them for making this choice. The hotel is very conveniently located near the railway stations, easily accessible by road and also by train from the Schipol Airport. It is easily connected to the heart of the city through bus & trams. Therein lies the beauty of this hotel, it is close to the city and yet slightly away for you to enjoy peace. The rooms are spacious and good & tastefully done. The bed was very comfortable. The staff were very courteous and always available for any service. The options for breakfast & dinner were quite a lot, even for vegetarian like me. Fortunately I met an Indian cook from Punjab, who could chat up with me in Hindi/Punjabi and made dishes suiting my Indian taste. The rates for the stay were very good (Euro 135/night) though the food was a bit steep (Breakfast @ Euro 21)

Reviews.Title: “Only for one purpose: RAI, the exhibition centre”
Reviews.Author: philippeenrique
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only for one reason, the RAI exhibition centre. Don't go here if you want to visit Amsterdam as any taxi, if you find any, will cost you 30 Euros to go to the centre. The rooms are impersonal, the air is sooo dry in the room, I thought it transform you into fish tank food... The restaurant is bad, enormous and the dishes are limited. They prepare the food not far from the tables and you end up stinking oily food coming out of the restaurant. Not a good address, despite the nice personnel at the check in counter.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel lacking any character”
Reviews.Author: headintheclouds13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because the meeting I was attending was being held there. I was surprised that the hotel is really in the middle of no where. You have to walk (though building works) at least 10-15 minutes to get to a restaurant and believe me you want to as the rooms are so depressing making room service not a good option. I stayed in my room one night and I wish I hadn't. The gym has a good range of equipment. I think the main profile of guests is business men and the odd tourist. It was rather depressing, plus for a hotel that is in such a bad location and with old decor, it isn't very good value for money. I am sure there are much better options in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Well located for forums, but customer service could be better”
Reviews.Author: aryna
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located if you are in Amsterdam for business and go to the RAI center. It's 10 minutes walking distance. If you want to visit Amsterdam, avoid it - it is far away from city center. The hotel rooms are clean, the bed is comfortable. I had some issues with the lights in the bathroom, which were blinkig so much I had to switch them off. So shower in the dark... Breakfast was good, good choice of cold food (cheese, etc..), a few pastries, and choice of hot food. The downside was on the tea/coffee side. One machine for all, very slow, you can imagine the waiting time to get your coffee or tea at 7am. What I was really unhappy with was the customer service. I asked for internet access when I arrived. The cost was around 6 Euros. They did not specify wifi or cable. When I arrived in my room, I took the cable as wifi in hotels is not always so good. I found out the following morning that there was a difference between cable or wifi. Cable costs 10 Euros. Just by principle, I am unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great location which made a fantastic stay for us”
Reviews.Author: DaniAlves7
Reviews.Content: The company that we booked with upgraded us to this hotel as they had made a mess of our booking but looking back at it now im glad that happened as this was a really nice hotel. We were able to get a train from the airport to RAI Station which is literally an easy 2 minute walk away from the hotel. On arrival the staff were great and gave us a map which explained all the important information about the city.. eg which tram we should get to city centre, attractions etc The rooms were great, spacious, clean beds and bathroom which is important to us and they were cleaned daily. Breakfast was amazing! a lot of choice. Access to the city was easy, next to the train station is a tram stop, with the number 4 tram taking you into the city within 20mins.. we never had to wait longer than 5mins for the trams to arrive! We even tried room service which was again excellent service. This hotel really made our time in Amsterdam enjoyable and i would recomment both the hotel and city to anyone of any age as it is an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in the vicinity of Amsterdam centre”
Reviews.Author: Dutchfamily7551
Reviews.Content: Recently completely restyled hotel and it shows! Great F&B and very friendly staff, which is willing to explain about Amsterdam, drinks and so on. Adjoining rooms no problem and superb breakfast (buffet style).

Reviews.Title: “Novotel offers average value for quite a lot of money”
Reviews.Author: MrsPiket
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is located in the outskirts of Amsterdam, 4km south of the city centre and 0.2km from the exit RAI of the A10 Autobahn. It is a good example of the average unimpressive business hotel. Location is at walking distance of the RAI Convention Centre. It is a reasonable starting point for visiting Amsterdam. RAI railway station is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The city centre is 20 minutes by tramway. Never enter Amsterdam by car, parking tariffs are the highest of Europe. The hotel was built in 1978 and completely renovated in 2006. The interior of the hotel is clean and adequately furnished. Staffs are competent. Our room was OK, had a good bed, a satisfactory bathroom and was clean. The buffet style breakfast was acceptable. The food in the restaurant is average, service was very friendly. As most hotels in Amsterdam the Novotel is somewhat overpriced and does not really offer value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Exceed My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Hatchback
Reviews.Content: Great Location just outside the city centre and not far from the airport. Very modern reception and bar. Large spacious rooms with Comfy Beds. You can also get BBC1 and BBC2 on the TV sets.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not located within the city though”
Reviews.Author: GAGTVM
Reviews.Content: The name of the hotel can be a bit misleading as the hotel is located about 20-30 minutes away by tram from the city centre. However, the trams are regular and the tram stop Is located a very short walk away from the hotel. Getting to this hotel from the airport is very easy as the RAI station is just a 2 minute walk away from the hotel. the RAI station is 2 stops away from teh airport and it costs only about 1.1 euros to get there from the airport. The tram station which will take you into the city is very closely located too. The hotel is predominantly used for conferences and conventions but is definitely a good place for tourists too. The hotel is quite big and the rooms are well planned, spacious and modern; equipped with all amenities . Theres enough space to keep 2 big suitcases and walk around without feeling claustrophobic! The bathrooms are modern and well done up The hotel lobby is spacious and very nicely done up. The receptionists are young and very courteous and will make you feel at home. Breakfast is a good affair and wont disappoint you; its quite a lavish spread and do make sure its built into your rate. The hotel doesnt have free wifi though, which is a bit of a letdown. there are 2 big imacs with a net connection though near the lobby that can be used. Overall a great hotel and given that the hotels closer to the city cetnre are more expensive and not as comfortable as the novotel, this could be a very good choice for your stay at Amsterdam. make sure you get an iamsterdam card so that you can have unlimited travel on the trams. Amsterdam is a nice city and most of the sights are clustered around the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location; Rooms too small for a 4-star”
Reviews.Author: youngtraveler28
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my parents and we stayed at this hotel for two nights. The hotel was sparkling clean, and there was great service all around. Staff were courteous and attentive to our needs. Breakfast was great, with everything you can look for in a European breakfast. Lots of bread, jams and butter, cereals, fruits, yogurt and more. There's bacon, egg and sausages along with some fried rice. Great way to start the day. My only concern is the room, which was quite a disappointment. We got a queen sized bed and only a sofa bed for a third person. Also, the room was too small and the only place where we could put our 2 big luggages were in front of the beds, which completely blocked remaining space. Wifi was reasonable at 5.95 euro for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the RAI Conference & Exhibition Centre”
Reviews.Author: MorrisEdward
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to the Rai and RAI train station. Staff friendly and helpful. A large hotel with 610 rooms therefor it needs to run efficiently. Had room service as arrived late. Was delivered faster than the informed 30 mins. Room was a bit stuffy and TV kept losing digital signal apart from that no grumbles. Very good breakfast choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: fischro
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff and dining room staff are fantastic to work with and pleasant. The breakfast buffet is one of the best we have encountered. The hotel is outside the city center but there is a tram very nearby that goes into the center and connects with other tram lines so getting around is not hard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Iulia17
Reviews.Content: I loved the room, the breakfast and the staff! The hotel is too far from the city center and the breakfast it's till 9, 30, too early for someone who is on vacation; internet and parking are very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad............”
Reviews.Author: Zwon
Reviews.Content: In my mind, Novotel hotels should have at least 3-4 stars grading and so when I knew of their price, which is of good value, I booked into this hotel. The location is in fact quite far from the city center and the main train station. However, as we only go out in the morning and come back at night and so this would be a problem for us. The outlook and the lobby is nice and large. Staff are polite and helpful. But the rooms are too small. Just judging from the decor and size of the room, I think it is only 1-2 star. Beds are not comfortable, so does the blankets. Our room faces the park and so we see green field every day. The toilet is clean but they installed a shower in the bath tub so that you have to stand in the bath tub to take the shower. However, there is no curtain, only a glass with half the length of the bath tub so that water is splashed out even when you are very careful. The good side is that the breakfast is almost the best I have ever tried in Western Europe's hotels. There are huge selections - hams, eggs, cereals, bread, sausages, soft drinks. Even boiled eggs they offered two types - all boiled or half boiled. Coffee or cappaccion can be taken from the machines. There are individual sofa seats for people going alone. There are machines in the lobby so that you can check-in and check-out by using the machine without going to the counter for help.

Reviews.Title: “New Year City Break”
Reviews.Author: csinclair1232
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I travelled to Amsterdam for a new year break. We travelled on the Pride of Rotterdam P & O ferry from Hull overnight and then stayed in Amsterdam for 3 nights befor returning home overnight on the ferry. We have been to the city before and really liked it. The hotel is situated quite far out of the city centre but it easily acessable from the metro and trams. (several types of ticket are available and can be used on both types of transport) The hotel is lovely inside with lots of seating and internet access in the foyer. The room was spacious and clean with a nice view. We had breakfast included which was fantastic, so much choice. We also just had a drink in the restaurant one night too which wasn't too expensive for a 4 star hotel. The only problem is, as the hotel is located quite far out of the centre you have to watch how late you stay out due to the times the metro and trams stop running. As we stayed on News Years Eve the transport stopped early and we had to get a taxi back which was reasonably priced but took a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for trip with family”
Reviews.Author: Ammipriya
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel during my Leisure trip to Amsterdam with family consisting of my Wife, son (08 yrs) and daughter (01 year). This Hotel is situated in a place called RAI, away from Amsterdam City and it takes around 35 munits to reach Amsterdam city from Hotel by tram. The Tram station is very close to the Hotel (02 munits walk). The train station is also adjacent. There are direct trains to and from Airport to RAI. I chose this hotel because I didnt wanted to stay with children in damrak area , which is famous for notorious activities, and also considering the fact that this Hotel is situated very close to train and tram station. However, those who are not traveling with small children, and the purpose of visit is leisure trip, this is not a ideal location to stay. The Hotel is very nice and the reception staff are very friendly. The hospitality is exceptional. The rooms are also very spacious, neat and clean. The breakfast at hotel is very good. So dont forget to book the Hotel with complimentary breakfast offer. Overall, a very satisfying stay.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: 1girlintheworld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outside the city center, but a great value and a short walk to the tram and train station making it convenient to get to where you want to be. There are also quite a few restaurants in walking distance if you donâ€™t feel like going back into the city at night. The staff was great and breakfast was beyond plentiful although I donâ€™t recommend dinner as they seem to have so few people eat there they donâ€™t quite know what they are doing. Clean and well-priced, if you are looking for an affordable option in Amsterdam this hotel is a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: PickyTravellerGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night for a short city break to Amsterdam, and Novotel kept up there usual good standards here. The name "Amsterdam City" is slightly misleading, as the actual city centre is a good 20 minute tram journey - although the tram is fast, frequent and cheap. Schipol Airport is also easy to get to/from - a 10 minute train journey from nearby Rai station. First impressions, I thought the room was slightly on the small side, but only once the sofa bed had been rolled out. The hotel was clean, tidy, and most of the staff polite. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: atwds
Reviews.Content: Decent Hotel with Good service, main lobby internet access and excellent breakfast buffet was included on our stay. Stayed with my daughter recently, very efficient staff and clean hotel. East access via the tram (#4) to downtown and the airport via nearby Station Amsterdam RAI. Would recommend it to anyone not wishing to stay in the downtown core directly but wants quick access to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “A bit far out from Amsterdam and standard Novotel fare”
Reviews.Author: joe_cool_joe82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very similar to the normal Novotel with the standard rollout desk (I like these very much) and comfortable bed. The Novotel is based out by the ring road, although you can read downtown using the trams in 20 minutes and it's very cheap. Parking is expensive at 22 EUR/day, although you can park next to the hotel (not in the car park) for free. We overslept on the last day and despite Novotel's late Sunday checkout were called and very rudely told we must pay a surcharge of 10 EUR/hours. After much discussion, I agreed to leave in 20 minutes and they reluctantly agreed not to charge us the surcharge, but meant I cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's a novotel, could be anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Ecuatoriana
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights here as I attended a conference just down the road at the RAI. It has recently been refurbished in the main public areas and is contemporary and bright. However I wished afterwards that I had stayed in a hotel in the city and taken the very easy and efficient transport, or a bike to the conference. The rooms are not at the same standard as the lobby, but are moderately sized. I think the most disappointing aspect of this grey monstrous block was the service from the staff. Cold and miserably efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tullagirl
Reviews.Content: We were on a Trafalgar Tour so didn't know what to expect. This hotel was very nice with big rooms. We had a triple room. Lovely buffet breakfast but the lift was very slow. There was a jog cups and teaand coffee in room which was appreciated very much.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel sucks greatly !!!”
Reviews.Author: gast101
Reviews.Content: I have never seen such a disorganized hostal. Ruth attendents and staff. Food sucked and took a long time almost 30 min for starters and maincourse even longer. I expected a higher standard and customerservice but was highly disappointed. I certainly will not come back with my colleages. I had the impression that roomservice was better but even a simple clubsandwich they screwed up. For compensation i made a complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast, handy to airport but would be better to be in city centre”
Reviews.Author: srh10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel which was good but try and get in the city itself. In saying that it is very very convenient to the airport (two stops on the train and only 2.60, trains go at least every 15 minutes, do not pay for a taxi), and easy to get into the city via tram or metro. Breakfast was excellent, as was the lobby with the computers. Room was good, although cleaning service not the best, air con was very dated. Huge hotel but they cope with the people well. Price was high but due to everything else being booked out, the Novotel was a pretty good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good room; excellent breakfast; convenient for airport and city centre”
Reviews.Author: fedupchoosingname
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel with good clean room. We slept well. Breakfast is excellent. This Novotel is ideal if you want easy and quick access to the airport and the possibility of getting into the centre (tramline 4 is a few minutes' walk away). We've stayed here before (February) and I plan to do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Esperanza_Turkey
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend trip with my husband to Amsterdam last fall. After reading reviews from TripAdvisor, we picked this hotel. We could get the easy breaks deal which included the breakfast, which was really good. When you compare the price to the center hotels you really don't need to stay in the center. This hotel is easily reached from Airport and the center. After 2 minutes walk you can reach the tram and train stations. The hotel room had enough space for a weekend stay. I would recommend this hotel to couples and families, I would stay there if I ever go back to Amsterdam. Maybe the front desk staff was not so friendly but the waiter/waitresses were all good at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...the best hotel in Amsterdam. That is why all the top football teams stayed there.”
Reviews.Author: necklace
Reviews.Content: Football teams from around the world were staying here over the Easter weekend for the youth team matches and they would not stay here if it's wasn't an amazing hotel. Also, as someone who never stays in hotels that allow children (I am a primary school teacher and want peace and quiet on my holidays) a hotel full of teenagers filled me with horror but you would not have known they were there. I can't rate this hotel enough and I wouldn't change anything about the whole weekend if I could do it all over again.-don't be put off by the grounds outside the entrance as they are landscaping to make the hotel even better. The food is outstanding both room service, breakfast in bed and the restaurant which is expensive but worth every penny. The rooms were bigger than I expected and very clean. Free use of the internet for 20 mins every day was fantastic to check up on flight details especially with BA striking. The staff at the hotel couldn't do enough for us especially Oliver at the bar who I would recommend asking for an ATB (Ask The Bartender) or a Jack in the box cocktail. The hotel is not in the city centre but once you have seen the number of tourists pouring in and out of the hotels to check them out or book dinner you will be pleased to have chosen this hotel. After 12o'clock you need to get a taxi back (20euros) as no trains or metros go to Rai station directly and for this price it is cheap! (I am comparing this to Amsterdam prices where a Macdonalds happy meal is Â£8 -yes you read that correctly!!! 4 times the price of ours!!!) Ask at Reception for a hotel card so that if you are too drunk or stoned you can show it to any taxi driver who will get you home and there is no haggling over prices as everything is done on a meter. Hotel Location is perfect next to Rai station and the number 4 tram (where we were first on and last off so you will get a seat). (Note you pay for the tickets actually on the tram) We brought an 'I amsterdam' card which was worth every penny as free transport (just scan your card like an oyster card) as well as getting into lots of places for free e.g. Van Gogh and the map and information inside the guide book were fantastic as it tells you everything you need to know e.g. what transport you need to take, opening hours, prices and information on all the attractions and restaurants in Amsterdam City. Note on Amsterdam itself: Lots of fun but very, very expensive so take LOTS of money. We didn't leave our hotel until midday each day and in 3 days managed to: Day 1: Anne Franks house, sex museum, erotic museum, candle light canal cruise & red light district. We walked from central station to Anne Franks house it is not far!! Day 2: Nemo science museum, Heineken Experience & the Ice Bar. Day 3: Van Gogh, House of Bols, Amsterdam Dungeon & Grasshopper Coffee shop We even had time to spare where we couldn't think of anywhere else we wanted to visit and so relaxed back at the hotel. Only had to queue for Van Gogh and Anne Frank all the rest we just walked into. Personally I would advice you to do the Heineken Experience out of everything - as there was so much to do and it was FUN!!! I hope this review is helpful as I read every review on tripadvisor before I stay at a hotel and even though this is my personal opinion I donâ€™t know anyone who stayed here this weekend (especially the liverpool football team) who would not rate it as the best hotel in Amsterdam and I know you will enjoy staying at the Novotel Amsterdam City.

Reviews.Title: “The complete package”
Reviews.Author: FrednGinger
Reviews.Content: We stayed only two nights. Good clean room and happy and helpful reception. Free 20 minute sessions on fast computers in the lobby. Close to train and tram but we would have enjoyed staying in the centre more as it was rainy and dark February time restricting getting into the city centre. The food served in the fusion restaurant was quite exceptional. Real food with lots of taste. And! room service produced a wonderful - red hot - three cheese - pizza - cooked to perfection. Yummy! And not expensive...

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisapaty
Reviews.Content: I only stayed just 2 nights but it was memorable the staff were friendly and the price was reasonable !

Reviews.Title: “Good Ambience and excellent services”
Reviews.Author: drreddy2010
Reviews.Content: Had a good time, less time spent on registration, food was really good, easy connectivity to the city, good ambience and staff were friendly and helpul.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Safe - great value”
Reviews.Author: babbilu
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely deserves better ranking on TA. Very clean, modern, spacious and comfortable rooms. All the conveniences you would need on a long trip, good location - a short walk to the subway station. If you are looking for a unique/boutique lux experience, then probably you would be disappointed. But if you are looking for a great deal on a clean, safe, modern hotel with knowledgeable and courteous staff in an unfamiliar city - then you cannot beat this value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in everyway”
Reviews.Author: popeyeScarborough
Reviews.Content: A number 4 tram will take you into the centre. This is the cheapest way to travel and are very frequent even running through the night. The hotel is situated that bit out of the busy and thriving centre. So, much quieter and relaxing place to stay in a beautiful recently extended and refurbished hotel. The staff very smart, polite, and caring. Rooms are spacious and well equipped, and very clean. Rooms are serviced daily. Fresh clean towels changed daily. Only one thing spoilt it for me, and that was, having to come back home.

Reviews.Title: “best marble room ever”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyKing
Reviews.Content: It was great and really cheap at the time as i got the deal through hotel.com and paid very low Euro's

Reviews.Title: “Just about everything you need on a short trip”
Reviews.Author: BoldlyGO
Reviews.Content: As others have said, an easy train ride from the airport, and a short walk even in the rain, is fine! I only had a short time to get to the centre to see the canals and Anne Frank's house but the number 4 tram is frequent and as you are at the terminus, a seat is easy. I bought my ticket on the tram. The welcome at reception was excellent and at checkout. Although I arrived at 11, too early they still said no problem and found a room. The Apple Macs in the lobby are good if you just need to check email etc. Free! The room was small but for me fine and in a quiet part of the building. The restaurant is temporary as they are doing renovation but again it was all done with impeccable service. I think the fact that they are in the middle of huge renovations yet it had no impact on me as a guest, has to be admired. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Instrumac
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam for the weekend in middle of a business trip. Was weighing the possibilities of staying at a hotel in the city center or away. The main criteria being the ability of spend the weekend in the town center. Novotel is not in the city center but is very conveniently located with a tram service every 15 minutes from just outside the hotel to the center. The added advantage of staying away from the center was the hotel had larger rooms which are difficult to find in the central hotels. The staff was very friendly and it was a pleasure staying there. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Not That Close To City Centre!!!”
Reviews.Author: Christy84
Reviews.Content: Just came back from this hotel, staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast very good variety. The rashers and sausages were abit greasy though. Free Internet at reception came in handy. Beds were so comfortable :) Mini Bar in the room expensive, a small bottle of water for example was just over 2euros. Quite dining area lacked atmosphere. All in all is a nice hotel though. From Airport get the train to the central station(main station in Amsterdam) and get off at the RAI Station which is the second stop from the airport. Cost of ticket = 2.80euros. RAI Station is literally a few mins walk from the hotel can't miss it To go to the center of Amsterdam which is called "The Dam" you get tram four which is literally 2 mins walk from the hotel.......downside it is a good 20/25 mins to get to the main centre, so it's close to the airport but not that close to the centre. On a night out prepare to pay 20/25 euros from the Dam to the hotel. My boyfriend and I use to haggle and try get the fare for 15 euros which worked sometimes!!! If staying in this hotel you will be using the tram alot if you don't have a car so buy a strippenkarten which works out cheaper as suppose to paying per journey from the hotel to the Dam. I use to buy the strippen karten at a souvenir shop for 7euros. All in all nice clean hotel, close to airport not that close to the Dam

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: 60Traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is under renovation, no sauna, no swimming pool but with new apple computer free internet in the lobby, friendly personnel, excellent restaurant well prepared food, what I like most in this hotel clean and comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: neofytos
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 seperate weeks on business. Its out the way of the centre but close to the businesses at Zuid. Only 20min tram ride to center tho and close to RAI metro. Its clean, with well equiped rooms (safe, desk, bath, good bed, desk). TV did have a lack of free English stations. Internet is pricey on wireless and 10euros for a 24hr continuous period via LAN cable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great, with a really good and varied spread at 21.50euros you need a good appettite to get your moneys worth. Downside is the building is pretty drap in appearance (not the rooms), but the rest its all brown colours and has a very rigid and unfriendly feel, althout sa I say the staff are friendly and the rooms are well decorated compare to the rest of the hotel. Its been having a major renovation for a couple of months at least, Iv never been bothered by it in my 3 week stay but you may want to check with the staff about which floor you are on.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel in Amsterdam..”
Reviews.Author: asderkal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and had the best time in Amsterdam. Hotel location is very close to the tram (number 4) station to the city center. The front desk was very helpful and polite. Free public internet computers were available in the lobby as well.Our room was large, modern, clean, well equiped and yet cosy. The bathroom is clean and has a bathtub. The breakfast is served as excellent buffet. It was a great way to start your day before all the sight seeing. Security was good as access to the lifts required a room card to be swiped through the reader before you could operate the lift. Thanks to the all superb staff and especially Kemal the restaurant. We would stay at the Novotel again.

Reviews.Title: “novotel amsterdam bye blr”
Reviews.Author: blrblr
Reviews.Content: The location is really good. It is just few 3 minutes away from RAI station, from where u can get with tram 4 to city centre within 15 min with metro 51 to central station (main train station) within 10 min with regional train to airport with in 10 min !!! (it is 2 stations) The hotel is very nice. The staff is very friendly. The breakfast buffet is good and offers a REALLY wide range. The rooms are clean & offer enough space. (the only minus is the old TV without cable) The bathroom is clean and has a bathtub. The hotel lobby offers free internet. BUT there are only 4 Macs and u they are literally NEVER free. The whole week it was everytime occupied and some people were waiting! No matter if morning, at 11, at afternoon and even around midnight always occupied. The hotel really needs to stock up with some addtional PC's. Another thing I would like to mention is that I was a little bit disappointed with Novotel, coz i have stayed often at ibis in different cities. And Novotel being the higer class hotels of the Accor group I expected more of it. But when u compare it to ibis hotels, the are basically only 2 differences. 1. The rooms are bigger. 2. The Bathrooms are bigger and have a bathtub. But that it. Nothing special otherwise, expect that the prices are MUCH higher at Novotel compared to ibis. (the deccor, furniture, etc is all same) So next time I will choose ibis again, if there is a option.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome to Novotel...followed by a warm welcome to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mrymrshd
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam was the first stop on our Eurotrip with our toddler. Novotel was close to the airport, taking a train is possible, but we would recommend taking a cab if it is your first time in Amsterdam. The hotel check in is at 12 but they were kind enough to let us check in at 10 AM, with a ready and clean room and all. The hotel was under renovation so all the facilities were not available, but it looked like they were doing a really good job and the renovations will make the hotel look very fantastic!! The room was great, spacious, clean, and had enough room for a baby cot/play area. The shower was amazing...and the breakfast was included and very well designed for all sorts o f travelers. I would definitely recommend staying at the Novotel, and try booking from booking.com to get a great rate!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate”
Reviews.Author: redalert300
Reviews.Content: Extremely comfortable beds. Friendly staff. Great breakfast. Near to the RAI Congress Center. Near to the tram station to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, very chic, cosmo.”
Reviews.Author: MilaseM
Reviews.Content: my comments are for the Novotel in Rotterdam, Brain Park but Rotterdam is not listed . Enyoyed our stay. A little bit expensive but good value for money. biggest disappointment was lack of Spa as i think Novotels have positioned themselves as business hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hot-deal in Amsterdam (even if you have a car) ! Very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Beth2009
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in Amsterdam ... we were travelling with our own car and one of our major problem was parking . Novotel had the perfect solution ... althouht the renovation we still be able to park our car ( limited places thoug) , paying 22 euros per night ... believe me it's a very good price for amsterdam city . It's not in the city center but it's a very good location ... calm and not even 10 min. will be on the tram nÂº 4 directly to the city center . VEry good surrounding . We made the evening cruise that ends almost midnight and we had no problem ti get back to the hotel , very safe ! Very nice staff ... yes the hotel is suffering a renovation but the staff makes all the effort to get this a minus ... and it suceeded ! Staff is always corcern to your well-being, even in the stressful moments that the hotel is complete. We had to book another hotel on our department and they did all to help us (special thanks to all with no excpetion) !!! Rooms are great, clean and vey very confort . I splet like a baby ... Great breakfast .... What can I say more ? It's the best value for money I could find in Amsterdam !!! Don't miss it !

Reviews.Title: “Novotel...great experience...perfect.!!!”
Reviews.Author: PatrickB1983
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with nice rooms (fantastic bed). The buffet breakfast was really good and the staff was very helpful and professional. Nice design, and free internet on the lobby. In 15 minutes you can be at Central Station with tram number 4. Great experience and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 5ummer5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with friends back in May this year. To be honest I was a little worried becasue of some of the negative reviews about the hotel being under renovation and the fact someone said the receiption and restaurant was in a "tent" in the carpark. I got there and was plesently supprised. We arrived at the airport and got a train to Station Rai. Stepped out the station turned right and we could see our hotel! Only a 5min walk or less and we were checking in. As for this "tent" in the carpark, its not a tent at all. It is a purpouse built structure and is very nice. The moment we stepped inside the noise (what little there was) stopped. Its very well sound proofed and air conditioned. We arrived very early (9:30am) and were allowed to check in straight away no questions asked. There was free internet on 2 macs in the reception and all in all my worries that I had before arriving soon faded. The rooms are very nice, spacious and clean. We were on the 15th floor and had a great view. There was a good selection for breakfast and is what you would expect from a hotel. I would highly recommend booking a room that includes breakfast. Breakfast alone is a bit pricey at 21euros! But worth it when booked with the room for an extra Â£5 or so. Yes this hotel is not right in the center of things but I liked that. I researched everything before I went so I knew there was the metro station close to the hotel, along with the trams (number 4). I knew we would be staying out later than the metro or trams would run, and there is a night bus that runs every half hour from 12:30am right through to 6:00am! Take the number 354a bus and it will drop you outside station Rai. It really is so easy to get around the city and exeptional value if you but a 24/48/72 hour ticket. These can be purchased from the metro section of station Rai from the machine. The people that worked there were very helpful and showed us what we needed to get. It was nice to get out of the busy city center and come back to the hotel. Great Hotel Great People Great City All in all a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and the hotel”
Reviews.Author: pradyDelhi
Reviews.Content: Its a good hotel in the heart of city . Good ambience in room with complimentary breakfast. Very close to Amsterdam Rai station so commuting also became very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing incredible, but decent enough if you need to be in the area”
Reviews.Author: rarchy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice. The 2nd time my booking said I was supposed to get an executive room which from the description made it sound like it was one up from the standard room, but it was exactly the same as the first time around! Room: Pretty small, 2 twin beds which I hate as I'm clearly 1 person I don't think it was fully booked. You can't even move them together as they're fixed to the floor! Bed wasn't very comfortable. It was however clean, had tea/coffee, nice enough bathroom. TV had more English channels than usual for a foreign hotel (usually just BBC news), had BBC1 & 2 which was nice. Service: Friendly staff - one thing I am disappointed with is that on my 2nd visit I was asked if I wanted to sign up for A Club theit loyalty scheme. As you can transfer the points to BA ones I said yes. I received an email shortly afterwards asking me to activate mt membership which I did. It said points arrive a few days after your stay. I didn't stay in another Accor hotel for over 6 months and I only checked my account a few days ago as I am booking into one (why would I check it otherwise?!). There were no points and when I contacted them to get them put on I was told you have to make the claim within 6 months. I find this quite poor considering that I signed up in the hotel when I checked in and received an email acknowledging this, so clearly I had stayed in the hotel, why were they not on my account? As I said its not like I had any reason to look at my account in the meantime, and I of course trusted them to do their job. This isn't really an issue with the hotel, more Accor, but I thought I'd put it on here. Food: Breakfast has a pretty good choice. I was disappointed with my dinner the 2nd time staying. I had a goats cheese salad, one of my favourite meals, and it was horrible. The goats cheese was more of a spread, it had a weird garlicy taste and a light airy texture, not at all like how I ever tasted it. The bread it was on wasn't toasted and really, for the price it was just very disappointing. The bar is small but cosy, we were there so long they were kind to let us stay a bit after it had closed but eventually had to tell us to leave! Location: Depends where you need to be. For the RAI it is perfect, a short walk away. For central Amsterdam it isn't very convenient, although it is right next to the station (overground and metro) which takes you straight to the airport and to the city centre in about 20 minutes. I would only stay here and recommend this hotel for convenience if you need to be in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel currently under renovations!”
Reviews.Author: biztraveler31
Reviews.Content: For the most part, my stay was unaffected by the current renovations. The main areas affected are the lobby and restaurant. There is no bar and the food service is basically a buffet. No fitness center currently as well. The rooms were fine - clean, modern and well kept. Should be a much nicer stay once it's completed.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt Fault It”
Reviews.Author: happylad123
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed over valentines weekend. We arrived early and were able to leave our bags. The staff were all extremely polite and helpful. We were disappointed on arrival as the hotel did not look as we expected- although we knew it was under renovation, however on arriving to our rooms we thought it was excellent. Large clean bed, sheets and room, clean bathroom and great city views (we were fortunate enough to be on the top floor). The room service was good but not much choice. Although the hotel was far from the city centre the trams were easy to use, regular and convenient and not that expensive. Overall i would definatly stay again, would reccommend the hotel and couldnt fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Disapointment”
Reviews.Author: KimeCalgary
Reviews.Content: One hour before our plane was to leave for Amsterdam the Novotel Hotel notified us the hotel was under construction. Reception was in a tent in the parking lot, this notification was given prior to arrival even though the hotel was under construction months prior to our arrival. Should we have been given more notice we would have changed hotels to avoid the noise and disruption which occurred during our stay. The hotel breakfast is located within the tent with upscale plastic chairs. At 20 Euros, the breakfast consisted of some bread, eggs, fruit salad and instant noodles in a plastic container. The hotel staff informed me that the price point provided good value and was comparable to other hotels. This may be so, but not in a tent. Once I ordered a cup of tea, it came with a bag in a cup of hot water. When asked for a refill of hot water, I was informed that they would be required to charge me and addition 2.50 Euros for a second cup of tea, this is ludicrous. On the wall next to my bed was snot (nasal mucus) which had obviously been left there by a previous tenant and had existed on the wall for a significant period. After three days I had to ask the hotel staff to remove it. The hotel is designated non-smoking but people were smoking in adjoining rooms. One of our colleagues was incapable of walking to and from the RAI conference centre due to a recent sports injury. On more than one occasion the Taxi's outside the hotel charged this individual 20 Euros to drive the 5 blocks to the RAI Centre even though the minimum charge was 7.50 Euro. When we complained to the hotel the told us that we were ripped off, but did not provide any assistance as to how we should resolve the situation. I've been to Amsterdam several times but this trip left me flabbergasted.

Reviews.Title: “The best service and Children friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sassymuffetts
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights with our 3 and 5yr old. From the moment we arrived at the Novotel the service was impeccable. They went out of their way to ensure that our children we catered for and entertained which made especially meal times wonderful. The location just outside the city centre was wonderful with tram and train only a 3min walk away and 10 min trip to city. The restaurant had wonderful food and the pub also attatched had an amazing range of beers. A wonderful experience all around and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel <> Great Value !”
Reviews.Author: ThreeAREwe
Reviews.Content: Great stay all around. Friendly and accomodating staff. Excellent location and easy to get around on the local trams. Clean and spacious. Good family hotel and an excellent breakfast !

Reviews.Title: “Far from everything but the RAI Conference Centre”
Reviews.Author: Swissdiver
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the RAI Centre and although it is 10 to 15 minutes walking distance, the Novotel was the closest from the venue (together with a Holiday Inn). Welcome was normal (although I could not get the upgrade I was entitled to). The room was all right, not very large, but clean with a nice view on the city (that is more than 5 km aways) and the Arena (3.5 km away). Staff was pleasant and ready to help at all time. Did not try the restaurant but the bar is OK (and suffers from no competition as there is nothing around!). In short: given the taxi price in Amsterdam (EUR 7.50 minimum charge - EUR 30 to go downtown), it is to be only used if you have business around or attend a conference at the RAI.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: trb0187
Reviews.Content: I am too lazy to read the other posts so I probably repeat them.... Husband & I stayed at the hotel in August for my 22nd birthday. Sure it is far from the city center but that gets you away from the nastiness of Amsterdam. I was happy we were out of the center. Hotel was kept clean. We had the free breakfast, nothing to write home about but it had more options than most European hotels + a cool latte machine. If you are looking to party, this would not be the place but traveling through the days and sightseeing, it was perfect for us! I would def stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great expereince for a holiday”
Reviews.Author: Jyo16
Reviews.Content: We visited Amsterdam on May 2008 and were looking for a comfortable value for money proposition for our stay there. We are a family of three and decided to opt for three in one room stay arrangement. I was apprehensive on how comfortable it would be. But we went ahead searched the web and found Novotel close to what we were looking for, good location close to a railway station, not too far from airport and reasonable charges. The hotel is turned out to be a pleasant surprise in man ways. Absolutely no delay in check in, our room was ready. Very Warm service and friednly staff greeted us in the lobby and at the reception. One good restaurant - the coffee shop that served sumptious buffet for breakfast and helpful staff. The room was just right with simple bu comfortable furnishing including a mini fridge, tea/coffee maker. Bathrooms were clean and comfortable. The staff was at all times helpful with tips for local sightseeing as also for helping in our shopping and daily requirements. There was no cause for complaint whatsoever. We paid USD 220 per night for a room including breakfast which we thought excellent value. Overall I would say this is probably one of the best hotel deals we have ever had on holiday and believe me we are all quite fussy on comfort and cleanliness! I strongly recommend this hotel for all families holidaying in Amsterdam, they will not regret

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding 4stars Hotel - almost 5stars”
Reviews.Author: fabmc
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with the Novotel web-site www.novotel.com and I got a very convenient special package (called 'Family package', but it's also for singles) with breakfast, transport tickets and free parking at the hotel for about 85 euros per night. The rooms are indeed 4stars and the service is even more (almost 5stars). Breakfast is definitely 5stars, with an incredible selection of cold and warm food. The hotel has 15th floors, but also 4 elevators for customers and good Internet facilities with printer and scanner. The best thing was the nice view of Amsterdam from a 12th floor from a large room window. The location is about 5km from city center (Dam square), but there is always a tram (line 4) waiting for your at just about 2 minutes walk from hotel entrance. Check-in time is 12:00 noon and they do not let you in a minute before. Also when checking out don't forget to show them the printout of your reservation, initially they tried to charge me 30 Euros more than the agreed total price, but after I showed them the printout they gave me the agreed rate and a little discount. I think this is a common awful behavior in Amsterdam: everywhere they try to charge you a little more than what's written on the menu, so just check all prices twice and enjoy Holland!!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for events at the convention centre”
Reviews.Author: AlbertandJudy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good, nice rooms and friendly staff. Staff were able to speak english and were very helpful with directions. The hotel is located quite far away from the city centre however it is easily accessible by tram (four), which is a 5 minute walk to the tram stop. The tram passes could be purchased at the hotel, which was quite cheap at 6.90 euros for 5 trips (15 strip pass) as each trip uses 3 strips. The breakfast, at first, seems very appealing with a large variety of different foods however after staying at the hotel for a few days the variety just remains the same. The cost of the hotel is relatively similar to hotels closer to the city centre, and would recommend looking for hotels in that direction.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam weekend”
Reviews.Author: ZITTAANDBLUE
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel 30th August - 1st September. Arrived at Schipol 10.35hrs, bought All-in-one ticket which gave us train to RAI station, all tram and bus transport for 3 days (19.70Euros) each. Checked into hotel just before 12 noon. Very easy, staff on reception were excellent, in our room by 12.10hrs. Room spotless with tea/coffee, minibar, adequate wardrobe and hangers, shelves and dressing-table space all good. Large double bed very comfortable and having stayed here on previous occasions, we found all the bedrooms had been recently upgraded and the rest of the hotel is undergoing work - it will not inconvenience you. The bar is cosy, on the ground floor and will not deter your sleep. The restaurant has a nice atmosphere and good menu for the average appetite - go to Amsterdam if you want anything a la carte, because this menu is nice, good cooking but not O.T.T. and prices are good. Breakfast is brilliant, plenty of hot food, cereals, fruits, yogurts, juices, cold meats, breads and cakes of various types, and piping hot tea or coffee. Many different coffees and teas to suit all taste buds. The staff are all very friendly and the tables and cutlery are spotless. It is a very modern hotel and as others say, it isn't typically Dutch style, but it is so easy to get into town on the no. 4 tram, and much to see on the way, this will always be my choice of hotel. We both look forward to our next visit. Thank you Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasure to stay here”
Reviews.Author: mdeboer
Reviews.Content: I had several lunches here, just because the location is convenient. You can park your car easily and from the hotel it's an easy drive to whereever you need to be in Amsterdam. When I needed an overnight stay, I booked a room. The room was great, large, clean. I had dinner in the hotel as well. The menu is nice enough, not spectactular. What is served, is well prepared. The service was fantastic. I felt very welcome, all the personnel I met were extremely hospitable. Whenever I travel again, I will favour the Novotel chain and hope the quality of service of this one is a standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great for access to City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Clarenrog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because partner was working at RAI Centre for a few days. The tram into city centre was a few minute walk, and they run every 10 mins or so, take you right into the heart of Amsterdam for couple of euros. Excellent for access to shopping or sightseeing during the day or restaurants etc at night. Felt very safe even travelling alone. Hotel was good quality. High standard at breakfast with good choice. Rooms clean and well serviced. Quiet bar for drink at night. If going to Amsterdam again would definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was OK”
Reviews.Author: stacelovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, we found the hotel to be comfortable and relatively clean. We stayed for 3 nights. We DID get smoked out in the lobby (apparently the non-smoking law goes into effect July 1, 2008). The breakfast was pretty extensive (and was included in our price). The proximity to the tram was good but the 25 minute commute was a little long. Our room seemed small, even for Novotel, with 2 adults and two young children. Overall, an average experience. Would definitely recommend a trip to Texel Island which is only about an hour's drive from Amsterdam plus a 20 min. ferry ride.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: IanrJones10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Nice, clean, comfortable room, friendly staff, nice restaurant. Didn't get smoked out in the lobby. The hotel is about 100m from the RAI station and access to and from Schiphol and the city centre is easy. If you're heading out of Amsterdam then you can take a metro to Amstel, Duivendrecht, Zuid or Sloterdijk rail stations and pick up trains from there. This hotel is a nice, more reasonably priced alternative to the city centre hotels and I would certainly stay here again. To give you some idea it is about a 15 minute metro ride to Centraal Station. If you get off the metro at Waterlooplein then that is down to about 10 or 11 minutes. Even closer to the hotel than the RAI rail/metro station is the terminus of the number 4 tram. Take ride into the centre on this and you'll see a little of Amsterdam at the same time. What you don't get at the Novotel is olde worlde chic. Not an oak beam in sight, and no canal buses or flower markets outside your front door. If that's wahat you want then prepare to pay a premium within the Amsterdam canal ring.

Reviews.Title: “It was what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: wareinbelgium
Reviews.Content: The hotel was what we expected and already fairly described by previous reviewers. The staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't have the breakfast as the price of 20.50 euro is a joke but we did have dinner and found the food and price was good. The hotel was easy to get to from the motorway and only a short walk to the tram station. The hotel sold us the tickets, although probably not needed as Amsterdam has a strange system where there is a person in a booth on the tram to pay or stamp your tickets. The hotel is a bit further out than I expected but it was OK, I certainly wouldn't drive in Amsterdam city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: EuroTripsrus
Reviews.Content: We were booked at this hotel for 3 nights by Gate 1 Travel. We were very pleased with our stay there. Our room wasn't huge but was more than adequate. The included breakfast was very extensive and of good quality. The desk staff were very courteous and helpful. The location was excellent for us - it is outside the city center - with the beautiful Amstelpark across the street. The RAI station is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel with a direct train link to the airport (15 minutes), train/metro to the city, and excellent tram service to the city. We were very pleased with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rainyday4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We had initial problem, my sister and I had booked a twin room but were given a double, when I rang the front desk they just sent up a fold up bed, after going down and talking to them we were given another room. It is a very nice hotel, a short distance by tram from the city centre, we ate there a couple of times, the food was great and the rooms are nice and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice try Novotel but too far out of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Bristol2008
Reviews.Content: Booked late via Cities Direct (who are excellent and I have used before). Wanted to visit Amsterdam, Easter week so not much choice left. Novotel is approx 25 minute tram ride up to Amsterdam City/Central Station so quite far out. The hotel was like a slightly better travel lodge but still 4Star prices for drinks and food. Pleasant staff in restaurant bit stuffy in bar. Tram was approx 400 meters walk to left of front door, next to RAI metro station. Overall OK for hotel but not great location for enjoying the city - especially as weather was cold and wet.

Reviews.Title: “Location far but good sevice and great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Tiramisu1
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Amsterdam is located near the RAI Convention center and RAI train station. It is a bit far from the city center but accessible through the #4 tram which is only a short walk away. The rooms are overall quite clean and efficient and the shower was excellent. The television was hooked up to the bathroom speaker which was interesting although I can see how it could be annoying. The sound sometimes was louder in the bathroom then in front of the television! The service was excellent for us. We had a problem in which we were charged something from the minibar that we did not eat and when we mentioned it to the front desk, it was instantly cleared. Also, they were very always friendly and welcoming. Breakfast was included in our package and was fantastic for hotel breakfasts. It is a buffet breakfast that consists of the standard fare (cold cuts, cereal etc.) but there were tons of variety (several shelves filled with different kinds of bread for example) There was also a selection of hot food including eggs, sausage, bacon and a rotating dish of pancakes or potatoes. Overall, we had a wonderful experience with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Room”
Reviews.Author: Superwoman07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Amsterdam City for 2 nights in late November. Good experience with the hotel- comfy room, etc., but not a location that I would recommend. It is very far out of the city center and you will walk a good 10 minutes from the tram drop off... area felt a little abandoned at night.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: muskrat2
Reviews.Content: The first stop on a three country Gate 1 tour and the best hotel on the trip, it was clean and convenient. Pickup a tram strip at the front desk, go out the front door, take a left and you can't miss Tram #4 which goes to the city center. Once there, find the canal bus (tickets good for a day and 1/2) and ride around the city, getting on and off at the major attractions. The rooms were nice with two single beds that were fairly comfortable, althought a little too hard. The shower only has half of a door, for whatever reason, and it's one giant step getting into the tub. A slight challange for old guys with bad knees. We forgot that European hotels don't furnish wash cloths. Next time we are going to bring some of our old ones and chuck them at the end of the stay. Excellent food and service at thr breakfast buffet. The only negative on the hotel was that we arrived at 9 AM and could not check in until 3 PM--unless we wanted to pay 10 euros per hour. They will allow you to check your luggage and, as mentioned earlier, downtown is easy to get to. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast buffet was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Seein'_the_world
Reviews.Content: Okay, but not as nice as in the photos on their website. We heard repeatedly how the Dutch insist on clean windows, yet the window in our room was filthy. The room and bath were clean and the mini-fridge amply stocked. The mattress was thin, lumpy, and hard. The material of the duvet cover irritated my skin and in typical European fashion, there was no top sheet. If too tired to go into town for dinner, I recommend the hotel bar. Not as obscenely expensive as the restaurant, but excellent food and service. We had a delightful server who recommended various Dutch beers for us as well as menu items. Delicious! The staff was friendly and helpful, particularly with our questions about the tram. The breakfast buffet is truly amazing. Thirty years ago when traveling in the Netherlands, breakfast was bread and coffee. The buffet offered eggs, fried rice, beans, fruits, breads, cereal, meats, cheese, and so much more.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel - Business or Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: TomBamber
Reviews.Content: I stay here 3 times a month on business. Primary reason is location to office. Hotel is clean, predictable and relatively efficient. If you are coming from the airport, take the train to RAI station then a 5 minute amble - save time and money by not taking a cab at the airport. Limited food options at hotel but bar is fine. Note, you are not in the centre of Amsterdam so you will need to travel to eat out and see the sites - Transport to Amsterdam City centre can be quick and cheap - take the train or tram from RAI station into the Centre. Rates very depending on occupancy - there are a lot of expositions in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice shame about the staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: tiflove
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and clean, however on the first day when we asked about public transport, they did not tell usthat they sold the tram tickets. The staff were very keen for us to charge things, giving the impression that they prefer the business traveller to tourists. Public transport was very good.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irenee_Shpak
Reviews.Content: quite nice hotel! Novotel is just a quiet, nice, shiny hotel, as all around the world. this one is not the exception. it's really huge, though rooms are really small. for me it was convenient to stay there because it is situated just 10 minutes walk from the RAI congress center!! but for those who are just tourists, i think it's not that comfortable, though there is a tram number 4, that connects the hotel with th city center. the tram goes till 12 at night! so if you go to redlights or will be late on any other reason, you will have to take a taxi, which is round 20 euro... so you choose) the room is simply standard, nothing special. the breakfast is tasty and really huge! the hotel staff is very kind and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dekor
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, me, better half and a friend went there for two nights and have to say one of nicer hotels I have visited! The staff were friendly, helpful, courteous. The room was quaint and comfy and warm. The bathroom was also nice although speakers built into ceiling that play whats on the tv gets a little annoying after a while! We picked this hotel as it is not too far from the city centre but is away from the hustle and bussle. Breakfast was lovely and set us up ready for each day! Would highly recommend this place to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ricardodesantaalbana
Reviews.Content: The checkin was polite and efficient and the room clean and comfortable. I have no complaints about this hotel and the breakfast was excellent; a very comprehensive buffet (rather busy but the staff were excellent). The hotel was in easy walking distance to the RAI convention centre and the RAI station as well as Tram 14 which takes you straight into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Pay as you go”
Reviews.Author: coconutpinksoda
Reviews.Content: I arrived early Sat morning 11/08/07 and was informed check in was an noon. Since the early check in free was 10 euro and hour, I decided to leave my bags. The front desk said I could leave my bags in a room down the hall. I waited by the desk in front of that locked room for 15 mins, but nobody every came. Went back to the front desk and checked in since I was so exhausted. They made 40 euros or about $60 on the transaction. You pay an extra 10 euro a day for the health club. The restaurant food was poor quality. But if you walk across the street to the Holiday Inn their restaurant was far superior. The train station is a block away. Take the #4 light rail to city center (outside of the station/not on platform). Room was great' well designed for a small space and modern, but the add on charges and poor quality food really bring the experience down to an unacceptable level.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seedy
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a modern building close to the RAI centre in the south of Amsterdam. In many ways it is fairly anonymous, having the usual amenities of the type, but is well run and has a range of shops as part of the complex. It is a little too far from the tourist attractions of central Amsterdam, but should suit business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “At least they were polite”
Reviews.Author: KTBs_Travel
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in early July on a travel industry rate. Arrived late morning, as do most tourists from the States. We could have checked in early by paying an upcharge of around 25 Euros. We opted to change in the bathrooms and leave our bags with the concierge for the day. I usually have great luck with Accor hotels in Europe, but I won't be booking the Novotel Amsterdam again based solely upon their early check-in surcharge.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotcomper
Reviews.Content: I was advised by a friend to stop at this hotel. I tried booking online but there was a problem with the site accepting my Mastercard. I called the hotel and was offered the same rates. We stayed 2 nights. Very clean rooms and plenty of room. Bar was average price, we never tried the restaurant but it looked very nice. Cost about 20 Euro in taxi to centre but you can get a tram from the close by station for 2.40 euro per person. Remember to use the Do Not disturb sign on door, we were woken both morings about 9am because we forgot (our mistake). Our key card would not work on the Sat night, this was resolved within mins by the helpful staff. We both said we would stop at this hotel again. (Europaboulevard 10)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... Even Greater Breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: Daman1992
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here, one we booked with Trafalgar Tours, and the other night we booked on the Novotel Website on our own. We arrived at the hotel late in the night. First impressions were good, its a bit out of the city-centre, but this brings down the room price. It is located at the RAI Centre, which is good for business travellers and the #4 Tram goes from the RAI Train Station to Centraal Station, which is the centre of Amsterdam. The RAI station is less than 5 minutes walk from the hotel and the area is very safe. We went to reception first thing to organise our room for tomorrow. We asked if we could keep the same room for the night we booked ourselves. It wasn't a problem. Staff even said we could have breakfast at a later time, which generally wasn't allowed. We went up to the room, which was modern and spacious for European Standards. It had two single beds. The next morning we had the Trafalgar Breakfast, which is different to the hotel's normal breakfast. It wasn't so good, but was filling. Had dinner at the hotel, delicious. Next morning we decided to try the hotel's regular breakfast. This was 19.50 Euros a person, but this was totally worth it! They had a HUGE selection of food, ranging from hot food, to cold food, to pastries.
