There were heaps of juice, and a table for children with Kinder-Surprises etc. This was a very, very good breakfast, and the shining point of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: prav30
Reviews.Content: Overall poor service - we were not satisfied with the room - management did nothing to help. Management was very arrogent. I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Near the RAI”
Reviews.Author: UrbietOrbi
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Convention Center in Amsterdam, called the RAI. I was worried that the Novotel would be quite far as every hotel in the area advertises "close to RAI". Despite my worries, I was able to walk to the meetings from the hotel in about 10 minutes. There is a convenient tram stop nearby and a communter rail that will get you in 15 min to the airport (Schipol). If you want to go into town, it's a half hour tram ride, it runs till midnight. While the hotel is well kept and efficient, the staff were a little impersonal, typical of the huge chain hotels in Europe. The other unfortunate aspect is that they do not have rooms for three unrelated people (a couple with child is OK as they have queens with sofa bed). There is no such thing as three beds so my two companions and I took turns sleeping on the floor. The hotel is gracious enough to only add 35 euros per night for the extra person so it was still better than an extra room. Don't even think about having breakfast there, they'll get you for 20 euros. Better walk over to the kiosk at the train station and have a coffee and a pastry. Over all, for the price, I am happy with what I got.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: Olga P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days and enjoyed it quite a bit. The hotel was not located in town but that was not an issue, the tram into town is right there (#4) about a block away and we could be in Central Amsterdam in just a few minutes. The train is also there which you can take to Schipol Airport or Leiden if looking for the gardens. The location was great, breakfast was really good and we had it included in our rate. It gave us a chance to really start our day nice. Although we stayed out late every evening we never had an issue or felt unsafe. The twin room was small by our standards here in the states but was perfect for people who are basically in and out on vacation. Bathrooms were new and modern. The staff friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The easy way to enjoy yoour vacation”
Reviews.Author: zivbahar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Novotel Amsterdam for 5 nights. Representatives were very friendly, professional & helpful, The room was very clean and spacious, All breakfasts were amazing, colorful and beyond expectations, The Novotel Amsterdam is easily reached by train from the airport and tram # 4 from city center. Always will be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingted
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Novotel on a 3 night stay in The Netherlands and would highly recommend it as a hotel, especially if you can get a good deal that includes the substantial buffet breakfast. Rooms are standard for this type of hotel. The hotel is 20 minutes from central amsterdam by the number 4 train, which terminates 2 minutes from the hotel. It is also 2 minutes from Rai train station, where you can catch trains to and from the hotel. Staff were helpful and the reception dest sells strips of tram tickets. The only down side is the distance to central Amsterdam, but the tram ride is reasonably scenic, so this isn't a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Learn about the tram”
Reviews.Author: SouthjerseyCraig
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in Central Amsterdam. It is located near a transit hub several miles away. The best way to reach the attractions is to take the #4 (I believe) tram. Its starting point is about a block and a half from the hote. (walk out the front door, and go to your left. The tram goes to the central rail station in Amsterdam. Eventually there will be a subway line between the hotel's vicinity and downown. I had two different rooms in this hotel. The first, unfortunately, was right by the elevator; the second was nicer. As in all European hotels, the room is small by American standards. It does not have a full shower door, but instead a panel that covers maybe a quarter of the shower. You'll easily get used to it. The restaurant downstairs is a good place for very basic food, and for the free breakfast. You might as well eat there during your stay. The concierge and front desk were very friently. Don't worry: their English is excellent. If you need a transfer back to the airport, the hotel offers one at about 10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Good”
Reviews.Author: Bli_Gus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in early Dec as part of Kumuka tour. The hotel is located near the RAI Congress centre, and is also conveniently located near the train/tram stations. A trip to the city centre takes approx 20 minutes. The room themselves are above-average size for a European hotel and were comfortable and pleasant. A plus was the tea/coffee maker they provided. Buffet breakfast was good, and staff were quite helpful. Avoid using the internet though, at EUR3 / 15 mins it is quite expensive. Overall a pleasant stay, and if you don't mind travelling by public transport into the city then this hotel is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: danipk
Reviews.Content: My brother and I decided to fly to Amsterdam in quite short notice, which is a bit of a problem in the end of August. We needed a hotel with reasonable prices, accessible for wheelchair and preferably in the center. After almost losing hope we found the Novotel which had 2 of the 3. It was a bit out of the center, but it had a trm station near by that took us within 15 minutes to the center of town. The price was good: we found a hot deal ON THE SITE of the hotel, where they claimed to give you an extra discount if you find a cheper price than their's on the internet. The room wasn't very big but fine for us. It was clean and kept up nicely. The bathroom was all set up for disabled. The staff was helpful and polite. We had breakfast only once, through room service. Although it was nice I don't think it was worth the 18.5 Euro per person they took for it. The bottom line: Nothing fancy but suits all your needs if you don't mind being out of the immediate center. 2 small things: 1. While making the reservation I specified a wheelchair accessible room, but when I called the morning before leaving to make sure all is in order they didn't have it written down. 2. At check out they almost charged us for 4 breakbasts altough we had only one. Not on purpose, I'm sure. Just keep out for those things. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Globus Tour”
Reviews.Author: davehol
Reviews.Content: Stayed during Globus Tour. Tram/ Bus/Train/ station only 5 minutes away. Very helpful staff. Room was nice and clean. We would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Novotel Amsterdam City
HotelInfo.Address: Europaboulevard 10, Amsterdam 1083 AD, The Netherlands
